snippet.title: Donald Trump camp pushes for ‘Indian model’, but Congress mocks EVM? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar takes you through a massive controversy that has sparked after the US Elections’ result was delayed. Even after 48-hours after voting the Americans are eagerly waiting for the results. However, the wait has stoked angry voters making them slam the democratic deceit.  The fear and uncertainty are sweeping all US.

Current President Donald Trump camp has pushed for the Indian model, but India’s Opposition has mocked it, why?

While BJP MP & National Spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi says ‘Opposition is not comfortable with the EVMs because the process of booth capturing is no longer possible’, CPI Leader Dinesh Varsh says ‘It is not America which wants Indian EVMs, its Trump and his supporters. Trump is American Narendra Modi’.

Watch!

#AmericaWantsIndianEVMs #USElections #USPolls2020

snippet.title: US Elections 2020: Donald Trump Vs Joe Biden; Who stands where? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar illustrates the latest updates on US Elections as voters cast their votes today. This election is unprecedented in many ways, one of the major reasons is COVID-19. The results also could be delayed because of the pandemic. Final opinions on the polls are swinging more towards Jow Biden rather than President Trump.

Both the candidates have begun their election campaigns. While Joe Biden hit out at Trump saying ‘Donald Trump wants people to believe that he is a mighty young man. When is the last time you heard a US Prez being laughed at by world leaders while speaking at the UN?’, President Donald Trump, on the other hand, claimed that 'We're going to win it. Let us do the Great Red Way'

Watch!

#TrumpVSBidenFight #USElections #USPolls

snippet.title: Fight for the White House begins; Will Trump come back for another term? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
In this episode of India Upfront, Rahul Shivshankar talks about the much-discussed and debated, the U.S Presidential Elections, which have kickstarted from today. Everyone has got their eyes glued to the U.S elections and what the result will be. Furthermore, what impact will the election bring on to the global markets is what the people are hooked onto.

To discuss the first day of U.S elections, Rahul Shivshankar is joined by Allan Lichtman, the man who predicted the last 9 US Presidents. Allan Lichtman explains the keys where President Donald Trump has failed in the '13 keys to the White House' formula. On the Trump vs Biden fight, Allan Lichtman further explains the process of how his team came up with the '13 keys to the White Formula'. He further adds that my system probes the fundamental dynamics of how well the party holding the White House as governed the country.

snippet.title: Congress' fraud comes to light; mute button on for the party again? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, today we discuss fraud in a Congress run society. Times Now has accessed a letter written by Congress rebel MLA from Rae Bareli Aditi Singh to the Economic Offences Wing. In the letter, she has alleged discrepancies in Kamala Nehru Education Society. 5 Bhiga of land was allotted to the trust to build a women's degree college however the college is yet to be constructed. She further stated that the Gandhi's trust's working is detrimental for the welfare of the people.

Senior Journalist, Ashutosh Mishra says that  Aditi Singh is just indulging in mudslinging.

#GandhiGhotalaClaim #CongLandScam

snippet.title: Radical 'Islamists' attack Hindus; Will opp backing beheadings take onus for backlash?|India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, today we discuss the attack on Hindus that are in minority in a Muslim majority country Bangladesh wherein their houses have been vandalized over rumors about an alleged Facebook post maligning Islam religion. Hundreds attacked Hindu homes, pelted stones, and taken down the roofs of the houses of the Hindu community. There have been multiple such incidents being reported from Bangladesh particularly in the Commula district.  

When questioned about the comment made by AIMIM leader Farhan Zuberi, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi says no action was taken against the person who said 'goli maaro'.

#IndiaVsIslamistIslamistTerror #BangladeshHindusAttacked

snippet.title: PM Modi lends support to France; War on TERROR equated to Islamophobia? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has sent out a clear message after the deadly attack in France saying that India stands together in the fight against terrorism, Congress is now leading an anti-France protest from Mumbai to Bhopal. Party leaders are leading the anti-Macron protest and are pasting French President’s posters on the roads. These posters term Macron as ‘sinful’. 

Many leaders have criticised Macron and have led shockwaves in India. BJP has slammed Congress over backing terrorism. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has given all-out support to France and the President. But what is seen in the city of Mumbai is questionable, many posters were seen on the grounds so people and animals can walk over his face. BJP has raised a massive question over how this is acceptable to Shiv Sena. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is standing in solitary with the victims in France and against terrorism.

'Anyone who cherishes liberty, equality, stands with the French President. He did not insult Prophet Mohammad', says, Anand Ranganathan, an author. Atiq ur Rehman, Islamic Scholar, explains to Rahul Shivshankar that the Prophet always said never go on a spree of hate-mongering, even for those who critisise you. I made sure that I don’t step on the posters of the French President on the roads. Shehzad, a lawyer explains that he does not support the beheading of Samuel Paty because if he supports it would be legitimising the terror act.

'Our Constitution does not give anyone a right to condemn any religious text. If someone violates the law, the law will take its own course', explains Shehzad Naqvi, a lawyer. Shehzad further questions that if Congress has a history of sleeping with the Radical Islamist forces. From Shah Banu judgment overturn to Triple Talaq. Can we allow Foreign Policy to be run by such people?

snippet.title: Swatch Bharat Abhiyan flops; How will Delhi tackle the massive pollution crisis? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, today we discuss the triple whammy for the citizens of Delhi, the National Capital is fighting air pollution, COVID, and now toxic water quality. Delhi is now battling toxic air and water, there is a spike in the ammonia content in the Yamuna river which has led to the shortage in several parts of the National Capital. Rahul Shivshankar questions AAP MLA and Delhi Jal Board VC, Raghav Chadha, on India Upfront, over worsening water quality in the national capital. What about the Delhi government’s master plan for water sewage? 

'Most of Delhi’s issues are manufactured in Delhi', questions Harish Khuranna, Spokesperson, BJP. Dr. Sanjeev Bagai, Chairman, Nephron, explains that Ammonia is a great enhancer of bacteria and virus’ and it will worsen the COVID-19 situation. In 10 or 20 years’ time, we could have chronic organ diseases.
 
This is yet another crisis that Delhi is facing. Air toxicity, jump in COVID cases, and now toxic water that has caused water shortage. There is a high level of pollution that has been reported in the Yamuna river. Yamuna river is the main source of water supply across the National Capital. 

There are high levels of ammonia that have been detected in the river because of which two of the main treatment plants have now been curtailed. The allegation right now is directly concerning Haryana and it has suddenly released high levels of polluted water which is why the supply had to be stopped immediately.

snippet.title: Imran Khan denied links with Pulwama but ministers hail him for the success? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Fawad Chaudhary in the National Assembly said that Pulwama was a great achievement under Imran Khan’s leadership. Imran Khan’s PTI minister admits to Pakistan’s involvement in Pulwama attack and says that ‘Pulwama mein humney ghus ke maara’, which loosely translates to we entered Pulwama and hit the people. It was then when Congress gave a clean chit to Pakistan and doubted Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Anurag, Spokesperson SP states that we as Indians have always been aware of the fact that our forces have been strong and we have stood with them.  

'Look what has come out on the floor of the House in Pakistan. What better conclusive evidence do we need now? The parties that played in the hands of Pak should now introspect themselves', says SP Vaid. '

It is not about credit to PM Modi credit or Manmohan Singh, but they doubted our braves; whether our braves could respond back in kind to Pak's terrorism & whether it was an internal job done by our braves', says Shehzad.

'MEA has also responded to Pakistan’s Pulwama Admission, it stated that the whole world is well aware of the fact that Pakistan did push out a lot of terror narratives. Anand Ranganathan explains that from Rahul Gandhi to Hari Prasad to Mamata Banerjee to Arvind Kejriwal to Farooq Abdullah, many believed that it was a BJP-RSS conspiracy.  This revelation proves that there is a massive failure of intelligence on the part of the Govt & the Govt should be questioned now,' says Ghanshyam Tiwari.

snippet.title: As PM Modi presents two options: Ram Raj or Jungle Raj, what will the voters choose? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss how voters in Bihar have discarded their fear of Covid-19 and have taken on the responsibility of casting their votes making it a record-breaking turnout.

With the onset of the Coronavirus pandemic, it was predicted that there will be fewer people coming in to cast their votes. However, Bihar citizens have proven the prediction to be wrong increasing the stakes of the elections in the state. 

PM Narendra Modi, has taken the opportunity to ask the voters to choose between ‘Ram Raj’ and ‘Jungle Raj’. Referring to Lalu Prasad Yadav’s previous track record, PM Modi described Tejashwi Yadav’s rule as Jungle Raj. 

#BiharElections2020 #RamRajvsJungleRaj

snippet.title: Pompeo pledges UN unstinting commitment to India; Status quo altering message to China|India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, United States’ Secretary of State Mike Pompeo answered various questions pertaining to India-United States relationship, how rattled China has lashed out by saying that the United States is clinging to ‘cold war’ mentality. Mike Pompeo says that every truth is beginning to see the authoritarian regime behind the Chinese Communist Party. He also adds that the virus that was unleashed from Wuhan has devastated economies and killed millions of people. Rajeev, MP says that today’s 2+2 US India meeting signals India and United States joining hands in shaping the post COVID world. Kanwal Sibal, Former Foreign Secretary tells Rahul Shivshankar that India and United States are together curbing China’s ambitions. Pavan K Varma, Former IFS states that China is the ‘unseen tiger’ in the US elections. He further adds that Mr. Donald Trump’s government is milking anti-China sentiment and any commitment made during this period should be taken with a pinch of salt.

snippet.title: New Laws for ‘Naya Kashmir’; One India dream now a reality? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, One India’s dream is now a reality as Kashmir integration completes and the Modi government notifies land reform. All Indians can now buy land in Jammu and Kashmir. The centre has created a new way for people outside Jammu and Kashmir to buy land in the Union Territory, the change in certain laws has been made after a year. 

The Centre has omitted the phrase "permanent resident of the state" from Section 17 of the Jammu and Kashmir Development Act that deals with disposal of the land in the union territory.

In its order, the home ministry said the new laws will be called the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir Reorganization (Adaptation of Central Laws) Third Order, 2020. It added that it will come into effect immediately

snippet.title: Is Pakistan Prime Minister trying to divert focus from his own country? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On The India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar talks about a letter written to the CEO of Facebook Mark Zuckerberg by Pakistan Prime Minister, seeking a ban on Islamophobic content. In the letter, Imran Khan was seen targeting France and India, he even citied towards the CAA Act. Countering his allegation, France has responded back by attacking Imran for not accepting the fact that ‘Islam has a problem’
Pakistan Prime Minister peddles fake facts in the propaganda war. Is confronting radicals, Islamophobia?
While, Lawyer Shehzad and Omar Altaf, Journalist, debate how Ahmadiyya Muslims are treated in Pakistan, Author Tarek Fatah says ‘Muslims should stop every Idiotic thing they have inherited from their predecessors if they want to end Islamophobia’ He further goes on to question ‘Have they forgotten 9/11, Mumbai, Parliament attack?’
Watch!
#ImranIslamophobiaLie #ImranKhan #Islamophobia

snippet.title: United Kashmiris reject separatism; Is there no rooms for Pak Dalal in Kashmir? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar talks about a proud and patriotic day witnessed by citizens of India. A series of unprecedented rallies were carried out on the streets of Jammu and Kashmir to publicly shame the Gupkar Lobby. The State flag and constitution was also burnt into ashes by the revolters.

This patriotic move came in after the Gupkar lobby time and again insulted the tricolour flag of India. Former Chief Minister of the State and Gupkar Gang member, Mehmooba Mufti had repeatedly insulted the tiranga and even refused to hoist the national flag, this in order to revoke Article 370.

Kashmiris gun for Gupkar Lobby; Is there no rooms for Pak Dalal in Kashmir?

As CPI leader Dinesh Varsh, defends the Gupkar lobby even as Kashmiris on ground reject their separatist politics, Author Tarek Fatah says ‘You keep whichever flag you want. But the flag, above every other flag, will be the Indian Flag. These people should be asked to go to Pakistan:’

Watch!

#TirangaNotTreachery #GupkarLobbyShamed #GupkarGang

snippet.title: War over 370 in Bihar elections, Did NDA turn polls to a patriot test? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
Just less than a week before the first phase of voting in the state of Bihar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi added a dramatic new twist to the contest during his very first election rally at Sasaram. By reducing the contest to a binary, PM Narendra Modi asked the voters to either choose patriotic Bharatiya Janata Party or a group of parties that are vocally backed by those alleged separatists who are crusading both nationally and internationally to restore Kashmir's separate statehood.

On the other hand, Mehbooba Mufti has tried to resurrect Kashmir's flag and she has also said, 'Will raise only the Kashmir flag and not the tricolour.' According to her Kashmir is a virtually separate state and it deserves a special status. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has also called on Congress, Rahul Gandhi, the LEFT & other members of the 'Mahagathbandhan' including the RJD to demonstrate the democratic credentials by condemning their ideological allies in Gupkar gang. 

#ModiTestsRahul #BiharElections2020 #Article370

snippet.title: Zakir Naik's 'Punish BJP Bhakts' call, Will sympathisers condemn? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Even since the Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP) led Government launched a crackdown on NIA designated hate preacher Zakir Naik, he has proclaimed his innocence loudly. Today is in a foreign country, running from the Indian law and from there he has again accused the Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP). Defaming the Party by trying to suggest that he has a communal anti-Hindu pantomime.

Times Now has accessed 48 seconds video where Zakir Naik earlier this year incriminating himself by calling Muslims to punish BJP bhakts.  

BJP MP & National Spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi slams hate preacher Zakir Naik on his anti-India rant.

snippet.title: BJP vows 'Free COVID vaccine,' Promise for votes or lives? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, In Bihar, the BJP is contesting in alliance with Nitish Kumar's Janata Dal (United). The JD(U) has fielded candidates on 122 seats, while the BJP on 121 in the 243-member Bihar Assembly. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) unveiled its manifesto for the upcoming Bihar Assembly Elections and promised that every person in the state will get vaccinated free of cost as soon as COVID-19 vaccine is available for production at a mass scale.

Taking a call, opposition slams BJP's 'opportunism'; and latter defends move & offers an explanation. Is BJP promising COVID-19 vaccine for votes as ire against Chief Minister of Bihar Nitish Kumar stings alliance?

snippet.title: Kashmiris protest against Pakistan, Gupkar Lobby won't shame Jehad? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India is observing October 22 as black day as a mark of protest against Pakistan's raids in Jammu and Kashmir in 1947. Pakistan army-backed invaders illegally entered into the Indian territory of Kashmir on October 22, 1947, and committed atrocities against the local populace.

"1947 was a black day, but 5 August 2019 was also a black day when people like me who believe in the Constitution of India were let down," says, Lawyer  Irfan Hafeez Lone. 

Kashmiri Hindu Sushil Pandit in a view says that 1947 was a massacre, unheard of in the history of Kashmir. No parallels can be drawn between 1947 and August 5 2019.

#KashmirAgainstPakJehad

snippet.title: Bihar Assembly Elections 2020: Who's ahead in the battle? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Bihar 2020 elections are just around the corner, just in a few days, the Bihar state will carry out its first phase of assembly elections. Times Now projects the number along with Founder & Chief Editor of C-Voter Yashwant Deshmukh which will give a sentiment of what exactly is happening by far as the Bihar 2020 assembly election is a concern. 

Times Now Padmaja Joshi presents 5 key takeaways from her interaction with voters.

"People of Bihar are upset & that intensified in the last 6 months. We mustn't forget that that LJP is contesting against the JD(U). This could actually damage the NDA if it goes wrong," says Founder & Chief Editor of C-Voter Yashwant Deshmukh.

snippet.title: PM Narendra Modi's 'Aatmanirbhar' policy pays off, why is Opposition still in doubt? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India is slowly turning towards economical adversity induced by the Coronavirus outbreak event. China's aggression at our borders turned into an opportunity. Data released by the Government suggests that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' message or go local to go global policy intended to reduce dependence on China appears to pay its return. 

Senior Economist Swaminathan says that the right now the figures prove that there has been a collapse in demand. That is the main reason behind the fall in import, not that suddenly we started to produce more.

"China crossed the line. It must pay for ruining the world economy with intent. PM Modi did a great thing by pulling out of RCEP," says Author Anand Ranganathan on PM Narendra Modi's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' policy.

#AtmanirbhartaTruth

snippet.title: PM Modi's strategic coup to sail with U.S, Japan and Australia; China isolated? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Australia’s decision to join next month’s Malabar exercise involving the navies of the four Quad nations will go a long way in emphasizing the group’s growing importance in the wake of China’s belligerent behaviour in the Asia-Pacific region.

The idea of the Quad was crystallized in 2005 to speed up intelligence sharing and strategic ties between India, Australia, Japan and the US, all leading democracies in the Asia-Pacific region.

Observer Research Foundation (ORF) Senior Fellow Sushant Sareen in a view says that Quad has been an idea until now. It has not been operationalized. 

"The only way to balance China is that we need to have an alliance of democracy. The nation must give primacy to the national security interest," says Defence Analyst Major General (Dr) GD Bakshi.
#ChinaIsolated

snippet.title: Opposition SLAMS PM Modi's message to the nation; Why politicise warning to citizens?| India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi's seventh address in these many months since the COVID-19 outbreak, Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent out an urgent reminder to all Indians. In his 12 minutes address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi cautions citizens against letting their guard down in the fight against COVID-19. 

He said, "Lockdown might be over, COVID-19 is not." Taking the chance, opposition hits out at PM Modi over his address to the nation saying, ‘missed opportunity’. BJP counters with a direct question asking ‘What's wrong with putting lives first?’    

Here are some of the prime reasons why PM Narendra Modi's address was 'well-timed'.

#ModiMessageToNation

snippet.title: Bengaluru Riots: CDR reveals Congress hand; Escaped in 1984, Exposed in 2020? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, August 11, the violence broke out in Bengaluru's DJ Halli and KG Halli areas over an alleged inciting social media post. More than 1,000 people resorted to arson while protesting against a derogatory Facebook post on Prophet Muhammad allegedly by the nephew of a Congress MLA Akhanda Srinivas Murthy (Pulakeshi Nagar constituency) in the Kavalbyrasandra area of Bengaluru City. 

Times Now accesses the CDR (Call data records) of ex-Congress Mayor Sampath Raj & aides of August 11. The CDR reveals that Sampath Raj called other accused in this case.

Author Anand Ranganathan in a view says, "Stoking violence or peddling outrage in non-Congress States has been the Congress' time-tested strategy."

#BengaluruRiotFinalProof

snippet.title: Kamal Nath tags BJP neta 'item', Will Congress president condemn? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, While addressing a rally in Dabra, the Congress leader Kamal Nath had, on Sunday (18th October 2020), allegedly called Ex-cabinet minister Imarti Devi an 'item’. The comments invited massive political backlash from across the political spectrum, with the BJP seeking action against the senior Madhya Pradesh leader by the party leadership.

“Wo kya hai… main uska naam kyun lun… aapko mujhe starak karna chahiye tha kya item hai… (Who is she… what’s her name? You all should have warned me… what an item!),” says Former Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh Kamal Nath and the crowd calls out Imarti Devi’s name.

The argument gets heated between BJP National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma and Political Analyst Ravi Srivastava over ‘gaali’ politics in Madhya Pradesh. 

#ApologiseToImartiDevi

snippet.title: Hindus hold tribute ritual on death of Muslim Neta; 'Secular lobby' tested?  | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Madhavdas, we discuss the death of Muslim leader Rasheed Masood. His family held a tribute ritual but, ‘hardliners’ called it ‘Haraam.’ The ceremony was performed as per Hindu rituals. However, Muslim hardliners say Islamic traditions should have been followed. ‘Secular lobby’ on test now. ‘First to cite ‘Hindu assertion,’ but ignores radical clerics?’

Custom & culture should always abide by the religious scriptures says Ilyas Shraffuddin, Islamic Scholar. There were numerous Fatwas of Muslims against each other says BJP MP, Sudhanshu Trivedi. A fatwa is only an opinion of a cleric says, Dr Syed Abbas. Rasheed Masood's son says his father never differentiated on religion and that a ceremony was conducted for his grandfather too.
WATCH! 

#IndiaVsHardliners

snippet.title: Kerala Gold Scam: NIA affidavit names Dawood; Was CM aware of terror link? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Madhavdas, we discuss the sensational disclosure Kerala gold smuggling case. NIA details Islamist terror design, sinister plan to smuggle weapons. NIA affidavit names men & modus and levels 'conspiracy against India' allegation. People linked to State CM Pinarayi Vijayan under the scanner.

Suneet Chopra, Senior Leader, CPI(M) rubbishes the NIA’s claims on the Kerala Gold Scandal. Rather than believing IT Cell propaganda, NIA should do some investigation says Kevin Mathews, Political Analyst. The Kerala CM has much to answer says BJP Leader Amit Malviya. One of the suspected in the case is expected to have links to Dawood Ibrahim. Was CM Pinarayi Vijayan aware?.
WATCH!

#GoldScamDLink

snippet.title: Congress opposes Kumbh Mela; BJP slams 'anti-Hindu' Gandhis | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Madhavdas, we discuss the ongoing row over the Kumbh meal. BJP hits out at Congress saying, ‘Insult of faith & festivals'. Puja, pujari, now 'pilgrimage'. Minister Udit Raj has hit out at the Yogi govt saying that Rs 4200 crores were spent on the Kumbh. The expenditure on this mela was wrong. 

I have not spoken against Kumbh Mela. It was just a context. Also, my views are personal, not of the Congress party says Congress leader Udit Raj. This anti-Hindu trade is in Congress’ DNA. Senior Congress leaders have often made anti-Hindu comments. If we are secular states, then Madrassas education should not be state-funded says Amit Malviya. 

I realized that it may create controversy. But when it became controversial, I decided to throw the challenge. I am not against any religion. My position is what the Constitution stands for says Congress leader Udit Raj. 
WATCH!

#CongVsKumbh

snippet.title: BJP shuts Madrassas in Assam, Opposition oppose secular reform? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
The Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP) has decided to end the appeasement of certain social groups for vote bank considerations. In a major historic secular leap forward, the BJP in an Assam has decided to convert Madrassas into regular schools with the modern syllabus. Infact, it's providing its state government in Assam to go for monumental reforms that will truly bring in a secular approach and most importantly a total separation of Church from the state. Opposition slams ‘secular’ reforms, but BJP says, ‘Move to end appeasement.’ 

Author Anand Ranganathan says that It astonishes me that Assam was running 614 Madrassas. All these will now be converted to mainstream schools. The step should be welcomed by all Indians.

#BJPMadrassaConversion

snippet.title: Left Lobby-Pakistan ISI Link EXPOSED, Fight for rights sponsored? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar today, we discuss the sensational disclosure by agencies in the Left lobby-Pakistan ISI link case. Left lobby ‘poster boy’ who was saluted by Lutyens for fighting Modi, turns out to be Pak agent. Are Lobby’s fight for rights sponsored? 

In the details mentioned in the NIA's chargesheet, Gautam Navlakha's link to ISI was out. Is left-lobby being funded to carry out campaigns to malign India? While the anti-India puppets have been exposed, who their mastermind was needed a little more digging. Now we know it is the ISI. Navlakha proudly gave Kashmiris a call for arms struggle says, Anand Ranganathan. 

‘Aap Chronology Samajhiye’ says Sanjay Hegde, Senior Advocate, SC recounts the important dates in the investigation of Bhima-Koregaon case and Navlakha’s meetings with the ISI.

#LeftLobbyPakDalalLink

snippet.title: Insider Neta exposes Cong's hand in riots; But will the party admit hand in carnage? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar demonstrates a shocking confession that calls into question Congress party’s self-professed commitment to secularism and communal harmony. Massive embarrassment for Congress comes to light as insider exposes party hand in riots. Congress leader, who was a victim of Bengaluru Riots confessed that one of the main instigators for the violence was a Congress leader himself.

‘My own neta tried to finish me’, claims Congress leader. Will Congress admit hand in the carnage?

While, BJP National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma says, ‘It is absurd how Congress has different standards for different states. Dalit lives to Rahul Gandhi only matter in states where his vote bank politics can be served’, Political Analyst Subharansh Rai says, ‘I hope Bangalore police carries out a thorough investigation and whoever is responsible will be brought to book’.

snippet.title: Despite protest by Hindu priest, CM Uddhav hardens stand; What is stopping Aghadis? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar talks about a protest led by priests and BJP workers and leaders outside the temple today. Revolts were held for re-opening temples. However, the Maha Vikas Aghadi hardened the stance despite the protest by Hindu priests. Pluck cards stating ‘Public can have madira in bars, but devotees barred from mandirs’ were also raised.

Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari lashed out at Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray questioning his belief of Hindutva. In response to this, CM Thackeray took a dig at Guv jibing his meet with Actor Kangana Ranaut.

Why are the Aghadis blocking people’s faith?

Lawyer Shehzad says, ‘‘From Mandir wahin banayenge, to mandir nahi khulwayenge’. Imagine what Balasaheb Thackeray must be feeling that in his state ‘madira peena’ is allowed but not preaching in temples’, and Spiritual Guru Acharya Vikrmaditya says, ‘There are over 4 lakh bars and restaurants in Maharashtra, how many people would be going there every day? Can we not make guidelines for temples?’.

Whereas Political Analyst Sumanth Raman says, ‘No need to gather in large numbers to preach your faith. You can always pray at home, this was said by Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan, now his party is calling out for the opening of temples’.

WATCH!

#MandirMahaBharat #AghadiBlocksMandir #UddhavThackeray

snippet.title: CBI probes top J&K Netas; Why was Roshni scheme scrapped? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar; after Times Now exposed a major newsbreak which could transform the demography of Jammu and Kashmir. The CBI lately took over the probe of ₹ 25000 Crores worth Roshni Land Scam and Roshni Act which was misused by many Netas to change the Jammu and Kashmir demography. In this CBI investigation, the Central team will probe roles of Netas in deliberately trying to alter Jammu demography. The plea filed against this scam claimed that 90% of the beneficiaries in Jammu were Muslims.

The names of those who plotted have been revealed: Beneficiary names out:
- KK Amla, Cong 
- Khidmat Trust
- Nawai-E-Subah, NC HQ
- Haseeb Drabu, ex-PDP min
- Suraiya Abdullah, Farooq's sister

Under the Roshni scheme: the encroached state lands were legalized by administrations. Although, the Act was later scrapped in 2018 by the Former Governor Satya Pal Malik.

Sambit Patra, National Spokesperson of the BJP says, 'The same Farooq Abdullah had said even if PM Modi comes with '1000 janams', he won't be able to scrap Article 370'

'Why was BJP silent? They came in power in 2014, why didn't they scrap Roshni Act? When are they bringing back our pandit brothers?' Aqib Renzu Shah, Councillor in Srinagar Municipal Corporation


#J&KHindusCheated

snippet.title: Congress mocks priest's murder; Level matter & not life to leftists? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar takes you through the latest updates in Rajasthan Priest Murder Case. Many political parties including BJP had lashed out at Congress’ hypocrisy as Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi marched to Hathras after the awful murder case but seemingly ignored the Karauli priest murder case.

Following these allegations, Congress has mocked the justice rally for the Karauli Sadhu. Congress MLA Ramesh Meena, when questioned about the silence of Gandhis over the Karauli horror, he said that 'Hathras level ka mamla nahi hai'

Is the Sadhu’s murder not as important as Hathras Case?

SP National Spokesperson Ghanshyam Tiwari says, ‘In Hathras case, the High Court asked clear questions to the BJP Govt & they did not give satisfactory answers’. While BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra says, ‘The Opposition party has its responsibility to raise the issues of atrocities against any person in any state’.

WATCH!

#CongMocksPujariMurder #RajasthanPriestMurder #CongressHypocrisy

snippet.title: Why is the Kerala government supporting Popular Front of India’s Chairman OMA Salam? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss a sensational disclosure. Popular Front of India has allegedly been linked to the Delhi riots as well as the Hathras conspiracy. The same PFI has allegedly been on the Left payroll. A dossier has been accessed that states Popular Front of India’s boss OMA Salam holds government office in Kerala. 

PFI has been linked to a massive number of alleged anti-national activities. The document states OMA Salam is a Chairman of a Muslim fundamentalist organisation. Popular Front of India has also accused of alleged fomenting communal hatred in the name of anti-CAA stir. 

Suneet Chopra, Leader of CPI (M), commented on the allegation. “It is the duty of the NIA to carry forward its inquiries. In these matters of the national importance, the Center is in power,” he said. 

Aparajita Sarangi, MP and National Spokesperson for BJP, questioned the Kerala government. “How is this man still in chair after the Kerala government has been aware of his activities,” she said.
#LeftPFIPact #OMASalam

snippet.title: Will Republic TV's fake TRP scandal taint the Indian Media's image forever? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the Mumbai Police’s recently exposed Fake-TRP racket. The Commissioner of Mumbai Police, Param Bir Singh, announced that three channels were busted in the racket, one of which is Republic TV. 

The channels have trumped up their TRPs to lieu in better advertisers and earn higher revenues. 

The Commissioner said that Republic TV bribed people to watch their channel in order to jack up its TRP. TRPs are calculated by an organisation called BARC that further handed over the task of installing barometers (that measure TRPs) to an organisation named Hansa. Ex-employees of Hansa have confessed of giving out the confidential data of where these barometers were installed to some channels like Republic TV. Republic TV then paid off households to keep their channel on the entire day. 

The Mumbai Police has further stated that Republic TV editors have been summoned and arrests might follow. 

Author, Anand Ranganathan commented on the TRP scandal. “There is bad blood between Republic TV and the Mumbai Police CP. If the data is manipulated by bribing households, it is a criminal breach of trust,” he said. 

Rahul Shivshankar asked Sanjay Jha, Suspended Congress Leader of his views on the alleged scandal. He replied, “The fourth estate is the pillar of democracy. This not only damages the reputation of Republic TV, it makes all mainstream broadcasters susceptible”. 

The Mumbai Police have further clarified that the revenue earns by these channels through manipulated TRPs are to be treated as proceeds of crime.
 
#FakeTRPScam #RepublicTVTRPFraud

The channels have trumped up their TRPs to lieu in better advertisers and earn higher revenues. 

The Commissioner said that Republic TV bribed people to watch their channel in order to jack up its TRP. TRPs are calculated by an organisation called BARC that further handed over the task of installing barometers (that measure TRPs) to an organisation named Hansa. Ex-employees of Hansa have confessed of giving out the confidential data of where these barometers were installed to some channels like Republic TV. Republic TV then paid off households to keep their channel on the entire day. 

The Mumbai Police has further stated that Republic TV editors have been summoned and arrests might follow. 

Author, Anand Ranganathan commented on the TRP scandal. “There is bad blood between Republic TV and the Mumbai Police CP. If the data is manipulated by bribing households, it is a criminal breach of trust,” he said. 

Rahul Shivshankar asked Sanjay Jha, Suspended Congress Leader of his views on the alleged scandal. He replied, “The fourth estate is the pillar of democracy. This not only damages the reputation of Republic TV, it makes all mainstream broadcasters susceptible”. 

The Mumbai Police have further clarified that the revenue earns by these channels through manipulated TRPs are to be treated as proceeds of crime.
 
#FakeTRPScam #RepublicTVTRPFraud

snippet.title: Shocking testimonies out in Hathras rape case; Is the political link in case proven?| India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, as the Hathras plot has sparked 'riots', after Islamist radicals, Congress' link emerged amidst the debate. A leader close to Gandhi's has now been unmasked. Congress leader Shyroraj Valmiki, allegedly close to the Gandhi family is heard fueling 'caste hatred'. 

Times Now confronted Congress leader Shyoraj Valmiki, he blurted out the truth confirming the Yogi government's suspicion that there was indeed a plot to fund riots in Hathras. Hathras victim's sister has also confirmed to Times Now that this particular Congress leader spoke to them and 'made them understand'. 

Gaurav Bhatia, National Spokesperson BJP states that the Popular Front of India had chopped off the hands of a professor in Kerala and Shyoraj Valmiki is also learning from the Popular Front of India.

'As and when BJP Government at Centre or State comes under public pressure because of their misdeeds, they always bring the theory international conspiracy of spreading communal riots' says Dinesh Varsh, Leader, CPI.

Shehzad, Lawyer explains that there are people who scream day in and day out about media trials but they normalise cutting somebody's hands without a trial.

snippet.title: Should Shaheen Bagh Lobby apologise for illegal protest? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Times Now took a position against the Shaheen Bagh protest calling them an illegal disruption. We were verbally and virtually lynched by the Lutyens ultra-leftist. The Congress Party, Opposition and the Left said that the Times Now was against the democracy. 

Today the Supreme Court has said that this protest at Shaheen Bagh was illegal because public spaces cannot be occupied indefinitely, that protest can only be carried out at designated areas. Public place for protest is unacceptable and causing inconvenience to the public violates the rights of the public. 

Lawyers in Action Mujeeb ur Rehman on Shaheen illegal protest says that the Supreme Court has said that democracy & protests are hands in hand and it’s the responsibility of the administration to respect the protest. 

#SCDemolishesShaheen

snippet.title: Hathras victim's kin and accused linked, Crucial call data records accessed | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Times Now has evidence that the cast a shadow over caste, atrocity narrative, that is being carefully built up around the Hathras incident. Call Detail Record (CDR) accessed which shows victim’s kin–accused were in touch. Over 100 calls between victim's kin & accused, they spoke on phone until the day before the crime.  

Political Analyst Sumanth Raman says that the CDR between the kin of the accused and the victim proves nothing. The stats show 90% of all rapes in India are committed by people known to the victim. Atrocities against Dalits are taken as a worrying phenomenon because the Dalit population tends to be the weakest section of the community. 

#HathrasProtestTruth

snippet.title: TMC leader Manish Shukla killed;  BJP & TMC play victim card; Who is guilty then? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, he talks about the recent killing of a BJP leader that has taken place in West Bengal. In less than three months, there have been 13 killings on the streets of West Bengal. There has been grotesque violence in this latest attack, as a BJP councillor has been killed and the crime took place in front of a police station. Both BJP and TMC play a victim card, but who is really guilty? 

To discuss on the same topic, Rahul Shivshankar is joined by Shehzad Poonawalla, Sudhanshu Trivedi, Tauseef Rahman on the show. Shehzad Poonawalla hits at TMC by stating that this is Talibani mindset and culture in the display. Sudhanshu Trivedi, MP and National spokesperson BJP adds that there is a series of political killings in West Bengal. 

Tauseef Rahman tells Rahul Shivshankar that Manish Shukla was involved in a lot of personal and family problems also.

snippet.title: Twist in Hathras gangrape case, Who's using caste to hijack crime? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, For the 5th day, the opposition has held a village to ransom by conducting a relay village. After opposition leader had turned to the camera and claimed that the CM Yogi Government is been derelict in its duty towards probing the alleged gang-raped and murder of a 19-year-old woman because she was a Dalit. Yogi Government cites ‘international plot,’ presents ‘proof,’ and promises action. ‘Who’s using caste to hijack crime?’ 

In a view Lawyer Shehzad says that the formula is ‘Hathras bahana hai , Dalit vote banana hai, siyasat chamkana hai, rajnaitik paryatan karwana hai aur dango ki aag mein UP ko jalana hai.'

#HathrasHateConspiracy

snippet.title: Hathras horror gets murkier; Another alleged attempt to malign the victim's family? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Hathras' story is one the outrageous stories in India currently, the youth is out on the streets protesting against Uttar Pradesh police and administration and people are seeking the hope for justice for the young Dalit girl who lost her life to abuse. 

The brutality of the incident went uphill when the administration started making remarks on the family, the District Magistrate was seen asking the family to side with them and not with the media, the video that surfaced online did not only expose the kind of the administration the state has but also how power is used to justify violence. As a citizen of India, you should ask yourself if women are safe in India?

The unstoppable investigation in Hathras case is nerve-wrenching, women are not only given basic respect they are also devoid of human rights. The sheer negligence and brutality played by Uttar Pradesh police and administration not only explains the condition of women in the state but also exposes the very fact that it is difficult for women to fight for justice- be it alive or dead.

The Hathras horror has now taken a murkier turn, as an unverified audio tape has leaked online, the tapes of both alleged Bhartiya Janata Party and Congress party leaders have now become a questionable angle in the case. The unverified tape also features the victim's brother.

The victim's brother spoke to Times Now, he then claims that the family is being tortured by the administration and he then reveals that the family's phone has also been snatched. Times Now's correspondent Priyank confronted the SDM of the area who was earlier allegedly caught jostling at the opposition leader. Priyank then asked the bureaucrat on why was the entry of media barred.

The Hathras horror has now taken a murkier turn, as an unverified audio tape has leaked online, the tapes of both alleged Bhartiya Janata Party and Congress party leaders have now become a questionable angle in the case. The unverified tape also features the victim's brother.

The victim's brother spoke to Times Now, he then claims that the family is being tortured by the administration and he then reveals that the family's phone has also been snatched. Times Now's correspondent Priyank confronted the SDM of the area who was earlier allegedly caught jostling at the opposition leader. Priyank then asked the bureaucrat on why was the entry of media barred.

snippet.title: Hathras case: With the DM being exposed, is the justice system at an all-time low? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the latest developments in the Hathras investigation.
The Hathras District Magistrate has allegedly threatened the victim’s family by saying, ‘Media won’t stay, you will have to deal with us.’ After the sheer negligence by the police in registering the FIR and then the brutality of taking away the family’s right to cremate their daughter in daylight, the father has expressed a lack of faith in the system. He said, “I am not satisfied with the probe. I want my daughter’s case to be probed by the CBI headed by a Supreme Court Judge…”

The Congress decided to march bare foot to the victim’s home but were stalled by the UP Police. A scuffle ensued between the police and the Congress where Rahul Gandhi was pushed to the ground. As they called out the dictatorial leadership of Narendra Modi, BJP slammed back calling out their selective political outrage. 

TIMES NOW’s Priyank Tripathi tried confronting the Hathras DM and probed him about the ‘threat’ that he made to the family. The DM, however, evaded the questions and replied that he shall speak about this later but there have been no response since then. 

Anand Ranganathan, an author, comments on rape as the most heinous crimes of all. While Sanjay Jha, Congress leader, states, “I do believe that somewhere down the line, the political system’s ‘credibility’ is at an all time low.” 

#HathrasGangrape #CopCaught

snippet.title: Babri verdict: Will it be rebuilt again after 28 years of conflict? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the recent Babri provocation following the Babri verdict. There has been a lot of provocation to rebuild Babri again after the CBI court’s judgement of acquitting the 32 accused. 

An alleged scheme has been exposed to incite Muslims against the Babri verdict. A campaign is being led called ‘Jihad for Babri’. At a time when the nation wants to move past the twenty-eight years old conflict, ‘Rebuild Babri’ is provoked in the name of fraternity.

Anand Ranganathan, an author, commented on the Babri demolition. He said, “Babri demolition was a criminal act as also held by SC in its Ayodhya verdict. No sane person can disagree. But the CBI court judgment didn’t concern this act of criminality.” 

#BabriVerdict #BabriProvocation

snippet.title: Hathras Case: Is BJP hinting at an encounter for justice? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the brutality and violation in the Hathras case. ‘Bharat ki Beti’ was violated twice, the first breach came from the brutes who gang-raped her and injured her severely, the second by the State.

The victim’s body was forcefully cremated in the dead of the night and the family was not allowed anywhere near. In fact, they were also denied one last glimpse of their daughter. Atishi, Spokesperson for AAP, has remarked on the case. She said ’People like rapists, in this case, think that they can get away with it.’ 

BJP’s Kailash Vijayvirgiya has given out a rather scary statement where he has hinted at an encounter. He said that the accused have been arrested and the case is in a fast-track court, all that people need to do is be patient. He went on to add, ‘Under CM Yogi’s rule, cars can topple anytime’.

#HathrasGangrape #JusticeForBharatKiBeti

snippet.title: Babri Masjid Verdict: Has the truth triumphed or stands defeated? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the acquittal of all 32 accused in the Babri Masjid case. The massive decision comes after a long wait of 28 years. The opposition claims that the Hindus have appeased whereas the accused declare that the truth has finally triumphed.

The court states there was not enough evidence found to hold against the accused. It has also deduced that the 32 charged were trying to stop the demolition instead of instigating it. BJP Leader, MM Joshi comments that they have accepted the verdict and urges everyone to let go of the conflict and concentrate on making way for Ram temple construction.

Subramanian Swamy, Rajya Sabha MP states that the courts have been independent and in fact, if there was no democracy and a majoritarian government in place from day one then this would have ended long back. Shahid Siddiqui, Editor of Nayi Duniya, also says that had it not been for Supreme Court intervention in 2017, the case would have been over long back. Binoy Viswam, Rajya Sabha MP, puts forth the opinion that ‘the whole system of administration under BJP rule has become slaves of religious fundamentalists.’ #BabriAccusedAcquitted #BabriMasjid

snippet.title: Why does Amnesty have four outlets in India and earning profits? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss MHA’s recent statement on Amnesty International saying, ‘Human Rights cannot be an excuse or defying the law of the land. It has violated FCRA norms’. The statement comes after Amnesty has announced that it is checking out of India for which it is blaming the government for being harassed.

Amnesty is functional in over 150 countries and has faced criticism by the government in all of them. However, after Russia India is the first country where it is shutting down its operations, Paranjoy Guha Thakurta, a Senior Journalist tells Rahul Shivshankar. Dr. Sudhanshu Trivedi also questions Amnesty having 4 outlets and earning profits whereas no other NGO has FDI.

Furthermore, topics like Amnesty being caught peddling fake news and yet refusing to apologise and their press release over one of its branch shutdown in Delhi in 2014 are all discussed on India Upfront.
#AmnestyEnds #AmnestyGetOut

snippet.title: Homicide not ruled out in SSR's death, 302 case only a matter of time? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss a massive development in SSR probe. The forensic panel of the All India Medical Sciences institute has not ruled out homicide as the probable death cause. The report falls in tune with the CBI probe. The toxicity report also states that there was no organic poison found in the body. 

 Another important question being raised is why there was insufficient light available in the room where the autopsy was conducted. The Cooper Hospital report has failed to provide a time of death which is extremely crucial to the case, thus it requires further probe. 

Some contradictions from the AIIMS forensic report are also highlighted. Since no organic poison was found in the body, drug overdose has been ruled out such as marijuana. The question that remains is if any inorganic poison such as psychotropic drugs prescribed psychiatrist was found in the body? On a similar note, Rahul Shivshankar also questions why did it take 41 days for the CBI to notice that the time of death was missing. 

Times Now also tries to confront the Dean of Cooper Hospital but there’s no response from their end. Dr Sanjeev Bagai, a Padma Shree awardee states, “The autopsy report doesn’t have a 'time of death’. So the chronological order is completely destroyed”.  While author Anand Ranganathan comments on the toxicity report. “AIIMS report does mention that no organic material was found but it doesn’t comment on inorganic material being found. Many of drugs either prescribed or non-prescribed are inorganic in nature,” he states. 

#SSRForensicReport #302forSSR

snippet.title: Bollywood slams 'politics of vendetta'; CBI will not confirm or deny foul play? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Times Now's relentless campaign for Sushant Singh Rajput has forced CBI to issue a 48-word statement. Meanwhile Bollywood slams 'politics of vendetta' and seeks bail and compensation for Rhea Chakraborty and other stars who are involved in the drug nexus in Bollywood and Mumbai.

Narcotics Control Bureau counters Kshitij Prasad's 'coercion' charge and cites court order in its defence saying 'no ill-treatment was observed by the court, we have followed rule book during the quizzing'. India Upfront brings to you the inside track of Deepika Padukone's reply to the Narcotics Control Bureau, Deepika Padukone has denied 'consumption of drugs'. As per the sources, she has replied on 'maal' chats and stated that 'maal' was a code word for a cigarette. 

Ishkaran Singh Bhandari, an advocate explains Rahul Shivshankar that the case is with CBI for 40 days and it is their responsibility to answer the public. 'CBI is an independent agency, they investigate the case based upon evidence, you cannot push them to accelerate', Syed Zafar, MP and national spokesperson of BJP explains Rahul Shivshankar over how CBI is probing the case and they cannot speed up the process because various other leads are involved. 

Ujjwal Nikam, a special public prosecutor, states that the public has to keep in mind that no intelligent investigating agency would divulge the material collected during the course of the investigation.

Shehzad, a lawyer says that they completely trust how CBI is functioning under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah than a Mumbai police functioning under the leadership of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray where Home Minister Anil Deshmukh declared the case a suicide in 45 minutes.

snippet.title: Krishna Janmabhoomi case in Mathura Court, Lobby claims Saffron assault | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Ayodhya's Ram Mandir has been one of the most historic verdicts that have been delivered by the Supreme Court of India. The row over Krishna Janmabhoomi has now created a stir in the country as a fresh suit has now been filed in a Mathura civil court to 'reclaim' the entire Krishna Janmabhoomi in the temple town. It is stated while claiming that every inch of the land is sacred for the devotees of Lord Shree Krishna and the Hindu community. 

Subramaniam Swamy, Rajya Sabha MP explains Rahul Shivshankar that there are places where the lord was born and therefore it has a special significance. 

It was reported that the petition was filed on behalf of Sri Krishna Virajman who stated that 13.37 acres of land of Sri Krishna Janmabhoomi is in the possession of the mosque and it should be returned. The court has now admitted the Hindu group's plea. Everybody is waiting for the hearing that is scheduled for Wednesday.

snippet.title: Deepika Padukone's Whatsapp 'MAAL' group haunts her; Trouble ahead for the actor? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the maal chats group issue and how Deepika was allegedly the admin of the group. NCB sources say Rakul Preet Singh has named Kshitij Prasad during her interrogation. She took names of 4 celebrities who Kshitij allegedly supplied to.  

Summoning is not making anybody an accused as of now says Ishkaran Singh Bhandari. Inside details NCB grilling schedule for tomorrow: Deepika Padukone to be quizzed at 10 AM. Shraddha Kapoor & Sara Ali Khan to be questioned at 10 AM. Prima facie this is a clear fact of ‘wrongdoing’ which requires investigation says, Hitesh Jain. 

We have to go by the NDPS Act which says if you have consumed drugs or bought them for personal use, then the offence is from 6 months to 1 year says Lawyer Abha Singh.

snippet.title: Deepika's summons by NCB politicised; Centre slams ploy to shield ‘drug A-List’ | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the NCB's summons to Deepika Padukone for her alleged maal chats and how the Centre has slammed the ploy to shield 'drug A-list.' Deepika Padukone’s summons with drug agency allegedly politicised as some call it ‘vendetta for JNU photo-op’.

Deepika Padukone acknowledges NCB summons but she will appear the agency on September 26. 'Drug chats' to be the focus. 
Deepika to go for questioning with her team. Top political reactions have been recorded on this. 'Why politicise drug ‘clean-up’?’
We have seen that leopard doesn’t change its spot and lobby is one of them, says Anand Ranganathan. 

It is true that there are a lot of individuals who have come in within the scope of this probe. But at the end of the day, NCB doesn’t have recoveries beyond 59 grams of Grass says Sanjay Hegde, Senior Advocate. Law is taking its own course and whoever is claiming that govt is ‘targeting’ these people is unacceptable because govt didn’t produce those chats says Rajeev Panday. 

#BTownDrugSummonsRow

snippet.title: Deepika Padukone's 'Maal' chat rattles Bollywood; Panicky celebs consult lawyers | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar uncovers the latest developments in Sushant Singh Rajput’s Death Case. The Narcotics Control Bureau investigation has allegedly named famous Bollywood celebrities including Deepika Padukone, Sara Ali Khan and Shraddha Kapoor. Sources say that the actors will be soon summoned by the agency.

Meanwhile, Times Now attempted to contact Deepika Padukone, who allegedly is underground in Goa. The sources also reveal that Jaya Saha, who exposed the names of A-listers in drug nexus, will be soon arrested.

Will B-town lobby defend this as well?

Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy says, ‘Bollywood is run by ‘drug money’ and therefore we must clean it up otherwise more & more Sushant’s will take place. I think the drug is a big problem in our country’.

While, Author Anand Ranganathan says, ‘Bollywood is experiencing its moment of redemption’, Lawyer and Activist Abha Singh says ‘Sanjay Dutt went behind the bars, Salman Khan has been in & out. Nobody is above the law’.

snippet.title: Bollywood's 'drug list' out; Has Jaya Bachchan's 'thali' remark backfired now? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar reads out the latest set of incriminating WhatsApp chats in connection with the Sushant Singh Rajput Death Case and alleged drug nexus of Bollywood A-listers. As NCB’s probe into the so-called drug cartel has intensified, more revelations are coming to light, the B-Town link is also getting more clearer.

Times Now has accessed some inculpating ‘drug chats’ that will shock the entire nation. Five top Bollywood personalities have been named in this racket. Four top officers have been roped in by the Narcotics Control Bureau SIT.

Chats also reveal that Kangana Ranaut and Ravi Kishan were apparently right about the drug nexus. They why were RS MP Jaya Bachchan and other Bollywood sympathisers shielding the crime?

Political Analyst Tanvi Purthi says, ‘Jaya Bachchan’s statement didn’t only deal with the dug angle. She was talking about how entire SSR justice campaign has been unfolded’, while, Advocate Ishkarn Bhandari says, ‘There has been a documented history of drugs and how that leads to terrorism, blackmail’ and Political Analyst Sumanth Raman says, ‘At some stage, the evidence is needed more than WhatsApp chats’

snippet.title: Unruly MPs resort to Dharna; Are opposition parties threatening the Government? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar illustrates an awful incident that took place in the Rajya Sabha’s Monsoon Session. Eight leaders from the opposition parties were suspended from the assembly for levelling dictatorship and violence in the parliament.

The leaders nearly assaulted the Rajya Sabha Deputy Chief Minister Harivansh. The unruly netas even denied the allegations, however, they were soon proved guilty after a video of their infringement came to light. Times Now accesses a video which exposes the apathy of opposition parties

For some heckling the Chair is dissent but discipline is a dictatorship?

Lawyer Shehzad says, ‘I call them Shaheen Bagh Democratic Liberals. These Shaheen Bagh Democratic Liberals want an inbuilt right of hijacking every institution that doesn’t agree with them’. Whereas BJP, MP & National Spokesperson, GVL Rao says, ‘I think they didn’t have the numbers and therefore they deliberately created ‘disorder’ the House. It is the Opposition which went back on the understanding that both the Bills will be voted upon yesterday itself’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: NCB drug nexus crackdown hits B-town; Was there an attempt made to shield A-listers | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar unmasks a major and unprecedented breakthrough that is coming to light after the Sushant Singh Rajput’s drug link was exposed. After SAD’s Manjinder Singh revealed how Mumbai Police ignored his complaint against the alleged drug party video of Karan Johar, the Narcotics Control Bureau is all set to probe the video.

According to sources, NCB will send Karan Johar’s house party video to the forensic department to investigate the authenticity of it. Sources also reveal that NCB has nabbed drug peddler Rajil Rafat after his link with Bollywood was found. A-listers from the film fraternity including Deepika Padukone, Varun Dhawan, Karan Johar, Vicky Kaushal and more will be interrogated.

Was an attempt made by Mumbai Police to shield the drug mafias?

SAD Leader, Manjinder Sirsa says, ‘A layman can also find out that how many of them are ‘stoned’ in this video’, while, Political Analyst Tehseen Poonawalla says, ‘If you want to investigate drugs in Maharashtra, please investigate the BJP, in particular, Devendra Fadnavis. This is a private video shot in somebody’s home. Merely touching your nose or merely there’s smoke doesn’t make it allegations of drug use’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: PMC Bank Scam: Wadhawans face ED heat, but Maha Sarkar rewards complicity? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar brings you an astounding development in the PMC Bank Scam. The Wadhawans are now attached and Enforcement Directorates are interrogating them and investigating their links to the crime. Times Now tracks down how the ₹ 100 Crores, a small part of the scam, was allegedly looted.

Wadhawans’ allegedly invested the looted money in assets and build a chain of ‘Fab Hotels’. These hotels are under the Enforcement Directorates’ scanner. This comes in as a mega crackdown as common citizens and the loyal customers of the bank are still waiting for their own money.

Although Wadhawans’ link to the PMC scam intensifies, the Maharashtra Government, on the other hand, rewards a blush post to the policemen who patronized the looters and gave them a free pass to travel and enjoy vacations amid stringent lockdown.

First Maha Aghadi government failed to probe the Sushant Singh Rajput death Case and now, they are leaving the common citizens on the same track?

PMC Scam Victim Harbans Singh says, ‘PMC Bank matter has not been properly dealt by anyone. It has been a year and not a single property has been sold & paid to the depositor’. Whereas Advocate Vikas Gupta says, ‘This whole politicisation of cooperative banks is also something that we need to look into’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: SSR Death Probe: Homicide angle not ruled out; Should 'Suicide Lobby' be probed now? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar demonstrates some of the exclusive newsbreaks in the Sushant Singh Rajput death Case. A closed-door meeting was been held by the AIIMS authorities and CBI team to discuss the preliminary findings. The report is also said to be final and conclusive.  

Times Now has accessed two explosive breakthroughs, first, Sushant’s handwritten notes which were reportedly optimistic and second, WhatsApp chats between Showik Chakraborty & drug peddlers where Showik allegedly insisted on procuring top class drugs.

Meanwhile, RJD MLA Arun Yadav’s remark against Sushant has sparked a major political row. Arun in his statement stated that Sushant is not a Rajput. Even the Central Agencies have not ruled out homicide angle, will the suicide lobby be probed now?

While Advocate Surender Chauhan says, ‘Let’s await the AIIMS report on SSR’s death’, BJP Spokesperson Sambit Patra says, ‘ I firmly believe that RJD is doing what it is best known for – ‘casteist’ slur even for a victim’

WATCH!

snippet.title: Congress honours Gandhis' birthdays, but defiles PM Modi's birthday? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar illustrates how Congress mocked Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 70th birthday today. Congress has marked Former PM Jawaharlal Nehru’s birthday as ‘Bal Divas’, Indira Gandhi’s birthday as ‘Ekta Divas’, Rajiv Gandhi’s birthday as ‘Sadbhawna Divas’, but, it has mocked PM Modi’s birthday as ‘Berojgar Divas’.

JNU leaders also mocked PM Modi's birthday and observe 'Unemployment Day'. This slandering attack of Congress has erupted major disputes and brawl between the two parties. The BJP has decided to honour Prime Minister Modi by celebrating his birthday week as ‘Seva Saptah’ and conducting several social services for the poor and needy.

If Congress can honour Gandhis, then why not PM Modi?

Supreme Court lawyer, Ishkarn Bhandari says, ‘Gujarat CM became the prime minister of India because he had delivered which he said and he has credibility’, whereas RJP Spokesperson says, ‘Everybody knows the reality of Lalu Prasad Yadav and how did he become the symbol of poor in India’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Kangana Ranaut exposes Sena's hypocrisy' Will Thackerays condemn this? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar illustrates how Actor Kangana Ranaut breaks her silence for the first time after her office was demolished. In her interview, the actor has gone after Thackeray, Shiv Sena Government and big bees of Bollywood. Kangana faced slandering remarks and threats after made a controversial statement, comparing Mumbai to Pakistan occupied Pakistan.

Kangana also raked up alleged drug party which was held at Karan Johar’s residence in Mumbai saying 'Karan gets special privileges. Aaditya Thackeray protects his friends'. The interview has exploded the word war between her and the Aghadi/Shiv Sena Government.

Will the Sena hypocrisy be exposed?

 While Advocate Ishkarn Bhandari says, ‘She is absolutely entitled to an apology’ and Political Analyst Ashutosh says, ‘Why Jaya Bachchan only to be blamed? We should also talk about Hema Malini’. Lawyer Shehzad says, ‘I think a lot of ‘demolition’ will happen at 9 PM on Times Now’.

snippet.title: Lobby shields drug syndicates; Is B-Town mafias’ probe defamatory? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar illustrates how Bollywood’s high-rollers are rattled in the drug nexus exposed by the Narcotics Control Bureau in the Sushant Singh Rajput Death Case. Some A-listers even tried to shield the drug syndicates, they, first suppressed SOS for Sushant and then buried lawmaker’s complaint.

In another explosive revelation, SAD Leader Manjinder Sirsa stated, ‘Mumbai Police are not serious about drugs clean-up. They are ignoring B-Town drug link’. When Times Now confronted Mumbai CP Sanjay Barve on whether his office received any complaint from Leader Sisra when he was at the post, he just simply laughed.

Rajya Sabha MP Jaya Bachchan too made some startling comments against the drug nexus investigation stating that people are making attempts to malign Bollywood. Is B-Town mafias’ probe defamatory?

While Lawyer Shezad says, ‘I am surprised about Jaya Bachchan’s response. Wouldn’t she want a ‘Drug Mukt Bollywood’ for her own grandchildren who will soon to enter the Bollywood themselves? Political Analyst Sumanth Raman says, ‘Jaya Bachchan in her speech only said that the acts of a few should not be allowed to tarnish the name of entire industry’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Chief Economic Advisor aids Centre's COVID policy; Is NDA’s growth blueprint ready?  | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront special edition today, Rahul Shivshankar speaks exclusively to Chief Economic Adviser of the Government of India KV Subramanian demonstrating how the Indian economy is in a delicate place. The GDP has slid down extensively due to the COVID-19 pandemic induced lockdown. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has called the pandemic outbreak “an act of god”.

While the Centre is searching for various measures to fight the deadly virus, opposition parties have raised suspicions on the authenticity of those measures. But, what is NDA’s economic revival plan? Will India’s declining economy witness a surge? How will the GP growth increase? Is NDA’s growth blueprint ready?

KV Subramanian says I think it is important to understand that this is a severe exogenous shock. One cannot deny that this is a crisis that has come from the pandemic. GDP is a flow variable & it is incorrect to attribute GDP as a stock variable. The unlock phase has a really enabled the recovery of several high-frequency indicators. We have to acknowledge that this crisis is very different from all previous crises which originated from economic factors’.

#SubramanianUpfront #COVID-19 #IndiaUpfront

snippet.title: Veteran beaten over mocking Maha CM Uddhav; Sena goes all out shield Sarkar? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, the shocking assault that was caught on CCTV camera where a veteran was beaten up black and blue; BJP has linked the assault to Shiv Sena goons. Shiv Sena first popularised their 'Ukhad diya' statement on demolishing Kangana Ranaut's illegal property over her PoK statement in Mumbai and now 'Peet diya' after beating up the naval veteran. 

The army veteran was beaten for Uddhav Thackeray's cartoon. The shocking attack by the Shiv Sena workers on a naval veteran who was thrashed for a WhatsApp forward. The veteran was cornered, punched, and dragged. Shiv Sena accused the 66-year-old veteran 'of being from BJP'.

When the veteran forwarded a cartoon allegedly on Uddhav, Sonia Gandhi, and Sharad Pawar, he was beaten by a group of individuals who suspected that he might have been from BJP. The chilling assault was caught on a CCTV camera.

When speaking to Times Now, the army veteran says that the Shiv Sena goons barged into his complex and beat him up. They were carrying metal tods and the victim was beaten allegedly by the Sena goons for forwarding a cartoon. The army veteran's daughter tells Rahul Shivshankar after the police came, she called the area MLA and since then the MLA has been helping them. She also stated that her father will now undergo a CT scan.

snippet.title: Rhea Chakraborty's bail plea dissected; 'Coerced confession' tactic used to escape? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront, after massive development in the Sushant Singh Rajput death case, ten arrests including Rhea Chakraborty that were made to bust the underground drug network that was going on in Mumbai. Rhea Chakraborty's remand copy stated that she was actively involved in the drug syndicate. Times Now has accessed Rhea Chakraborty's bail plea in the Sessions Court. 

Rhea Chakraborty allegedly accuses Narcotics Control Bureau of coercing her into confessing 'guilt' saying 'Narcotics Control Bureau is spinning a false narrative to implicate her. Times Now has also accessed Rhea Chakraborty's statement to Narcotics Control Bureau and she told the Narcotics body that she 'took hash a few times'. 

Ketan Vaidya, a journalist explains Madhavdas G that he thinks that Rhea Chakraborty is not the only culprit in this particular case who has retracted from the statements. Hitesh Jain, a BJP spokesperson explains that retraction of confessions is an age-old tactic. Rahul Eashwar, an activist, believes that Rhea Chakraborty had every right to defend herself. Shehzad, a lawyer explains how the trend of Rhea Chakraborty's lawyer is to play the 'victim card' at every opportunity.

snippet.description:
On India Upfront, Kangana Ranaut and Shiv Sena war that broke out over her PoK statement which has now created a huge uproar for the freedom of speech in India, has now taken political turns. BMC's demolition drama that took place today where they demolished Kangana's office, is now taking a new turn over demolishing her home. Kangana Ranaut stated that this is a clear act of vendetta and such a shocking abuse of power. BJP hits out at Maharashtra government saying 'State-backed intimidation'. 

Times Now has accessed the order copy of Bombay High Court. The copy states that 'BMC seems to have woken up now. Demolition drive is not bonafide. Kangana Ranaut did not get enough time to respond'. The process of demolition smacks of malafide. Maharashtra government held a high-level meeting today, as per the sources, Sharad Pawar expressed 'unhappiness' over the demolition move. BMC will make its stand clear tomorrow whether the rules and procedures were followed or not, says Ketan Vaidya, a journalist. Shehzad, a lawyer explains that for 65 days, Mumbai police was snoozing. BMC was 'dozing' and today they started 'bulldozing'.

snippet.title: Massive vindication for Team SSR; Showik Arrested, Rhea next? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Madhavdas G brings you the biggest development of the entire investigation related to the drug link in Sushant Singh Rajput Death Case. Showik Chakraborty has confessed a game-changing revelation by nailing Rhea in a drug cartel. He admitted before the NCB that Rhea was the one who asked him to procure drugs.

While several cover-ups are slowly unravelling in Sushant’s death case, an attempt was been made to block Times Now’s coverage. A gag lobby filed a PIL in the Bombay High Court seeking a stop on media trial that has been conducted in the case. Times Now can be threatened, however, the truth cannot be buried.

Meanwhile, sources indicate that NCB is likely to summon Rhea Chakraborty over the alleged drug chats with brother Showik. Rhea and Showik will be jointly interrogated by the agency.

Is Rhea Chakraborty soon to be arrested? Should the media coverage be stopped?

Lawyer Ashish Dixit says, ‘In each investigation with respect to SSR case, Rhea was blamed’.

While Political Analyst Sundar Balakrishnan says, ‘With respect to drug angle, everybody is involved. Be it politicians, police or film actors’, Advocate Chauhan states, ‘Showik didn’t disclose that for whom Rhea was procuring the drugs’

WATCH!

#RheaNailed #RheaEndgame #JusticeForSSR

snippet.title: Brazen bid to derail SSR fight; Are proxies blocking justice for Sushant now? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar takes you through the latest inputs in the Sushant Singh Rajput Death Case. An attempt to choke the truth is now unveiled by Times Now in the High Court after lawyers and ex-policemen group-up to gag vilification of police.

Previously, Rhea Chakraborty had criticized alleged media trial conducted by various news channels and now a group of ex-officers and lawyers united by filing a PIL in the Bombay High Court over ‘media trial’ allegations in the SSR Death Case. The family of Sushant is slamming this move calling it a plot by proxies.

Are big parties making an effort to suppress the truth of Sushant Singh Rajput?

Activist Rahul Easwer says, ‘The Supreme Court in its order has pointed out the vilification campaign’. While, Senior Lawyer, Hitesh Jain says, ‘For the last 6 years, this lobby is teaching us we need to tolerate unpopular views’.

Lawyer Shehzad shares his views and even lauds Times Now for its relentless coverage on SSR case and unearthing drug cartel link.

Watch as Rahul Shivshankar also confronts Nilesh Navalakha, one of the petitioners.

#CantBlockSSRJustice #SushantMurderProbe #JusticeForSSR

snippet.title: PM Modi's life in grave danger; Is Pakistan involved in slander? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar demonstrates the three-word threat ‘Kill Narendra Modi’ which was sent by an unknown user to National Investigation Agency via email. He also reads out certain alleged inciteful commentaries made earlier by some individuals. Times Now has accessed this spine chilling scandalous hazard.

This letter reveals the acute rise of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s haters and dangerous politics that abet in assassinations. The origin of email is tracked to elements based outside India. The NIA is now authenticating the mortal threat and sending an alarm across 3-security agencies. Prime Minister’s security cover is also highly enhanced.

Are Modi-baiters agitating assassinations now?

‘The NIA document says that it has not carried out any investigation which doesn’t mean the multi-agency coordination centre hasn’t done the fact assessment of this threat’, says Nikunj Garg, Senior Editor- Internal Security, Times Now.

While Lawyer Shehzad says, These who called Maoists as the single largest threat to the country turned around and said that they were NGOs today’, Political Analyst Vivek Srivastav says, ‘As Opposition, it’s our duty to criticise, to find faults of the government, to question the government. However, when it comes to the assassination, I think the nation should stand together’.

WATCH!

snippet.description:
