We can’t make blockbuster movies from Nepotism. says, Film Trade Analyst Komal Nahta.

snippet.title: Will countries of the world make China pay for its COVID-19 cover-up? I India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, will the Chinese finally be accountable to the world for their many detrimental policies and indiscretions? The countries look to Courts in search of answers especially as evidence of the Chinese conspiracy of hiding COVID-19 emerges. 

"The American courts have long-arm jurisdiction under which any person who causes citizen harm can be brought to court," says Aryama Sundaram, Senior Lawyer 

"We should file a suit and seek appropriate damage relief in India from China," says Vikas Singh, Former ASG 

The Chinese have long gone without paying their accountability to the world but its time that nations across the world unite to take China in hand. 

Is the world paying the price for a virus that was spread willfully by the Chinese? 

#ChinaMustBeTamed

Watch this video to know more!

snippet.title: Leading innovators take a stand; Will boycott call make China bow? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On the India Upfront Special Edition today, As the stand-off in Ladakh infused and while the two sides try to resolve the imbroglio through negotiations there is a clamour growing within the country that's calling for the boycott of Chinese products. The Chinese and their goods and services are pretty omnipresent across the length and breadth of this country from diapers to big heavy machines. The Chinese export and also supply us with daily needs.

Boycott China movement peaks as the millions sign on to the petition but skeptics slam misplaced jingoism.
‘Will boycott call make China bow?’

If we want to bring in 'Ache Din', then we have to be an open economy: Gurcharan Das, Author & Economist

Western investments are higher than China's investments: R Jagannathan, Editorial Director, Swarajya

Watch!

snippet.title: JNU History Committee mocks Saraswati Civilisation webinar, Mighty opposed as myth? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, JNU History Committee opposed webinar on ‘Saraswati Civilisation’ & made ‘Imposing communal agenda’ barb. Mighty Saraswati mocked as ‘Myth’. ‘Separatists’ Sharjeel Imam & Umar Khalid allowed, but Saraswati River ‘Dammed’ in JNU?

‘How is it that events calling for the secession of J&K from the Indian union are tolerated, even celebrated, as free speech in JNU, but not the celebration of the greatness of the Indic Civilisation?’

‘How is it that 'Tukde Tukde' slogans that advocate violence against the Indian state are celebrated in JNU as an exercise in free speech, but not the glorification of India’s civilisational history?’

Listen in to what NSUI has to say on this matter. 

JNU faculty’s doublespeak! Here’s a quick look at how others of communal mindset get a free run in JNU.

Watch how Sharjeel Imam allegedly communalised the anti-CAA protests.

#JNUBlocksSaraswati

snippet.title: COVID patients alarm, Dignity denied even in death?  | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Patients literally rot to death! Grandmom in hospital toilet & naked man found in COVID ward. Forget about getting proper care, now, dignity denied even in death. Don’t allow leaders to getaway. 

It’s not fair on patients well after death. We cannot be complacent during this crisis. says, Nephron Chairperson Dr Sanjeev Bagai.

Our public health infrastructure has been on the verge of collapse for several years due to insufficient funding by Central Govt & State Govts. COVID is spreading rapidly in Maharashtra & Delhi because of its dense population. says,  Political Analyst Sumanth Raman.

Are some of the State Govts focusing more on PR than actual work? says, Lawyer Shehzad.

What we can see is the exhibition of inhuman & insensitive nature over Corona crisis. says, BJP MP & National Spokesperson GVL Narasimha Rao.

snippet.title: Ramachandra Guha pits Gujarat against Bengal, Why citing only British intellectual? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Lutyens scary divide & rule ploy. A direct assault on 'idea of India' as Ramachandra Guha pits Gujarat against Bengal. Angry India slams ‘Congress bhakt’. But Guha remains defiant, hits back with taunt. ‘Is anti-Modi lobby going too far?’ 

‘What were Mr Guha’s motivations behind tweeting Philip Spratt’s divisive quote?’ 

Take a look at the series of tweets by Ramachandra Guha. Look who he quoted. Interestingly the man Ramachandra Guha relies upon was an ‘Ideological opportunist’ who attacked the idea of ‘One India’ himself.

Philip Spratt’s fan Ramachandra Guha forgot that Gujarat has been home to some of the most prominent cultural icons of India. 

 Despite being caught out on facts, the Congress party can't seem to bring itself to condemn Mr Guha's retort.

#LobbyDividesIndia

snippet.title: Delhi riots crackdown truth, Will Lutyens take charge of sham? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Mumbai overtakes Wuhan in terms of Corona count & Delhi on the edge of crisis. 30% of cases are from Mumbai & Delhi, 34% of deaths are from Mumbai & Delhi.

Lutyens sows seeds of misinformation & slams ‘Anti-Muslim’ riot chargesheet, but fact check debunks Lutyens ‘Lies’. There’s no prejudice in police probe as 211 Hindus & 229 Muslims booked. ‘Probe is fair, why fake Islamophobia?’

‘On what basis is the lobby alleging a miscarriage of justice in the Delhi riots when an almost equal number of accused from both communities have been named in the FIRs?’

‘Will Hindu-phobic lobby apologise?’ Take a look at the TIMES NOW’s fact check over lobby’s ‘spin’ over Delhi riots.

1,300 people have been arrested and it includes a roughly equal number of Hindus & Muslims in Delhi riots. says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

#DelhiRiotFactCheck

snippet.title: China talks of 'Consensus', Did Rahul Gandhi scored own goal? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Rahul Gandhi fires 3rd salvo at PM Modi. RaGa backs ‘Lost territory’ narrative but China springs a surprise & talks of ‘Positive consensus’. PM Narendra Modi's deft diplomacy pays. ‘Has the Congress jumped the gun?’  

In a democracy, it is the job of the Opposition to oppose. But at this time of crisis, it should be their job to be on a united front. The Opposition should stand with the Govt in matters of national security. says,  Defence Expert Maj. Gen (Retd)

They (lobby) are irritated because we seem to have resolved the situation (Indo-China standoff) amicably. says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

We don’t have adequate information about the issue at the LAC. says, Senior Journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta.

#CongChinaSelfGoal

snippet.title: Indian Forces prove their mettle, China begins deescalation? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, After trying to steal India’s land, China begins climbdown in Ladakh. India’s forces prove their mettle & firm PM Narendra Modi Sarkar refuses to blink. Congress won’t question China Ki Chori but doubts our Forces integrity.

‘At a time when India’s forces have managed to stare down china & prompted a pull-back, should the Opposition be undermining their efforts by talking about 'Lost territory'?’

‘Now that the Chinese have begun to de-escalate in Ladakh, will the Opposition acknowledge that the Centre and the Army's approach have prevailed?’

1st clear signs of a climbdown. Eyeball to eyeball in Galwan & the Finger area of Ladakh has ended. Both sides have moved back between 1& 2 kilometres. Srinjoy with details. 

Watch!

snippet.title: India's road to China block by the opposition, Why Congress going soft? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India gets China to talk. 'Mazboot' Bharat won't relent as Dragon forced into dialogue. 2nd round of military talks on troop build-up, infra, incursion. 5 major issues on the agenda. New Delhi draws the 'Red' line.

DISCLAIMER: Undated Video

Every Indian ready to fight China but Sonia Gandhi Sena weakens our fight & declines help to braves at the border. First deletes anti-China tweet & now, backs out of ‘Patriotic duty’. ‘Why’s Sonia Gandhi’s Sena so soft on China?’ 

Watch India’s road to check China. Why the road is important?

When the Doklam crisis happened, Congress chose to get its briefing from the Chinese envoy and not from MEA back home. says, BJP's Amit Malviya.

#IndiaChinaTalks #CongSoftOnChina

snippet.title: Tablighi's gets a free pass for 'Dhaka', Centre suspects state complicity? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, shocking details of West Bengal government’s complacent approach to bringing Tablighis to justice as it gives wanted foreigners a free pass to Dhaka. Responsible for wilfully spreading COVID-19 across the length and breadth of this country during the initial stages of the outbreak, these people had lied to visa authorities about what they intended to do India. 

Even with the Centre issuing lookout notices for Foreign Tablighis, the Mamta Banerjee government in a blatant disregard for the law has allowed the attendees to leave the country. Tablighis on the run were caught by the forces at the India-Bangladesh checkpoint. 

The Bengal Government has responded by vehemently denying all allegations. There is sheer politics behind this matter on a free pass to Markaz by Bengal says, Anirban Banerjee, TMC Supporter 

How long before the West Bengal Government stops prioritizing politics over public health? 

The Delhi Police charge sheet has named 20 Hindus in its investigation proving once and for all that it is the lobby which is selective not the State. The Police’s commitment to fair investigation exposes leftist propaganda created to malign India. The question remains will The Hindu-phobic lobby which was questioning the credibility of the police now apologize.

#MamtaMarkazFreePass #HinduphobicsApologise

snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Pak unleashes ISI on Indian Diplomat. Pak stoops to roadside stunts to intimidate Indian Diplomats in Pakistan. TIMES NOW's Vivek Narayan with details. 

Ambassadors of Pakistan are always engaged in subversion, sabotage, recruitment of spies. they are the most uncivilized nation we've ever encountered. says, Defence Analyst General Bakshi (Retd).

Shaheen protesters get ready but intel EXPOSES its intent to disrupt. Tahir Hussain-Umar Khalid plotted 'hate' here & now, call to block 'lives' again. Massive police presence at spot. ‘Is Shaheen ‘maidan’ for mayhem?’
‘Given that many Shaheen Bagh protesters had remained adamant on staying on in the early stages of the COVID crisis, despite prohibitory orders, is the latest attempt to resume protests any surprise?’

snippet.title: Lobby sponsored Delhi riots, This was for revenge against PM Modi? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Corona count close to 2 lakh, over 8,000 cases 3rd day in a row. But, almost 50% of the patients recovered. Surge inactive cases big worry with India now globally at 4th position.

Can the lobby continue to deny that the Delhi riots were premeditated and pre-planned, allegedly with the active collusion of the ‘Tukde tukde gang’ and Tahir Hussain?’

Evidence shows that the lobby is only seeking to derail justice by invoking the ‘Islamophobia’ narrative to protect Tahir Hussain and the ‘Tukde tukde gang.’

Communalising of deaths or riots is the beginning of the loss of the moral stand that anyone pretends they are taking:, says, Nalin Kohli, National Spokesperson, BJP. 

These charge sheet revelations on Tahir Hussain regarding Delhi riots are shocking. This charge sheet on Delhi riots has busted their (lobby) wild propaganda once and for all, says, Anand Ranganathan, Author, and Columnist. 

We should not forget that we are discussing that legislator who was involved in throwing petrol bombs and instigated a riot, says, Surabhi Hodigere, a political analyst. 

 #TahirFundedHinduHate

snippet.title: Shiv Sena & Sonia Gandhi linked to attack Hindus but militarises Islam? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Shiv Sena signs controversial order and legitimizes the role of ‘Hate’ group. BJP has slammed the moved calling it a ‘Betrayal of Hindus’. Sadhus lynched in Maharashtra, but ‘Islamists’ have given pedestal is the real question here. 

At a time when the activities of the members of the PFI have been under the scrutiny of NIA & MHA, couldn't the Sonia Gandhi- Shiv Sena have sought the co-operation of other Muslim NGOs in Maharashtra?’

‘By roping in the PFI for burial duties during the COVID-19 pandemic, hasn't the Sonia Gandhi – Shiv Sena given a clean chit to the alleged radical links and crimes of some of its members?

Hundreds of PFI leaders & activists have been charged under UAPA (during Cong & Communist regime) but the moment BJP comes to power, the former starts supporting such organizations, says, Anand Ranganathan, Author and Columnist.

It is a known fact that PFI is indulging in communal activities, says, Gopal Agrawal, spokesperson, BJP
Another important discussion is on the cyclone Nisarga which hit the states of Maharashtra and Gujarat today. India braces for 2nd storm & Mumbai's 1st cyclone in 100 years. Red alert for cyclonic storm across Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Raigad. IMD scales up Nisarga Cyclone warning.

#SoniaSenaWithPFI  #MumbaiCycloneAlert

snippet.title: CM Arvind Kejriwal seals Delhi borders for a week, India unlocks but state blocks? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, CM Arvind Kejriwal's big ‘Delhi first’ push as he seals Delhi borders for a week. This move sparks ‘Bed for residents’ debate & raises eyebrows India wide. ‘India unlocks but Kejriwal blocks?’ 

Bats for ‘Islamist’ Tipu Sultan, retained honour for Aurangzeb but stalls Vivekananda statue. ‘Icon for India not for Congress'? 

Is the 'Misplaced priorities' argument against the construction of a Vivekananda statue motivated by appeasement politics on the part of the Congress?

We are more concerned about more people coming into Delhi for treatment and how do we handle the load. We'll only close the borders for a week. We have increased the beds for COVID patients in Delhi hospitals significantly. says, AAP's National Spokesperson Dr Ajoy Kumar.

#DilliForDelhiitesDebate #CongBlocksVivekananda

snippet.title: Donald Trump attacks 'Leftist' twitter, Not tame of 'Pro-Lutyens' social accounts? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Trump guns for ‘Leftist’ Twitter & scraps Twitter’s legal immunity. The massive debate sparked in India. India’s ‘Rightists’ welcome move & urges PM Narendra Modi to take a similar stand. ‘Time to tame pro-Lutyens Twitter?’ 

‘As mediums that host an exchange of views, should social media platforms be held responsible and liable for the views they allow users to share?’ 

We need to look much more closely at the use of the word ‘Algorithm’ by social media to duck accountability. says, Rajya Sabha MP Rajeev Chandrasekhar.

We are living in a world where you believe what you see, but unfortunately what you see is written by those who see what they believe. says,  Author Anand Ranganathan.

#TwitterTimeUp

snippet.title: After Congress-China 'Chamchagiri', Is Lobby inviting Beijing? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, China eyes Ladakh take over as it plots attack provokes Forces but Abdullah’s kin ‘Invites’ China. Stance sparks outrage & anger. After Congress'  Chinese ‘Chamchagiri’, lobby backs Beijing, not braves?’

Big victory for PM Narendra Modi Sarkar as States shamed for dumping poor. Don’t starve & charge stranded. The top court speaks for migrants & onus is now on the Opposition States. ‘Will lobby ‘Speak up’ & say sorry?’ 

I am really appalled by Safia Abdullah’s tweet on China. I think this goes back to probably Nehruvian idea (Hindi-Chini Bhai Bhai). says, Political Analyst MRV.

You should never visualise your neighbour as good or bad, it is a Bipolar world. says, Political Analyst Vivek Srivastava.

#LobbyInvitesChina #SCExposesLobby

snippet.title: Jamaat Markaz to Mumbra, 'Corona Gathering' gift for Eid? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Corona ravages the State. Fetters on Hindu festivals in the name of Corona norms, but ‘Gathering’ gift on Eid. ‘Jamaat Markaz to Mumbra, appeasement risks India?’ 

‘Isn't the alleged lifting of restrictions during Eid in Mumbra in Maharashtra a clear example of appeasement on the part of the Aghadi?’

TIMES NOW newsbreak explodes. Mumbra administration confirms violation over ‘Mumbra Markaz Rerun’. Deputy Commissioner says 'Lockdown will be enforced again'.

We have to accept that the manner in which Mumbai has dealt with social distancing & lockdown, it really appears as if it has been trying out the herd immunity hypothesis. says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

#MumbraMarkazRerun

snippet.title: Congress wants great power but no responsibility? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Patients left to die in streets & migrants herded like cattle. Thousands of lives are being risked, but it’s not Rahul Gandhi's problem & distances Congress from decisions. ‘Wants perks, not responsibility?’ 

When Maharashtra Govt needs to get the fullest support, Rahul Gandhi is undermining that govt. We cannot have social distancing in govt especially when we are a part of the govt. If Rahul Gandhi cannot support Maharashtra CM, then why is he offering advice to the PM? says, Former Union Minister Jayanti Natrajan.

Responsibility & Rahul Gandhi don’t mix just like ‘drinking & driving’ don’t mix. says, Lawyer Shehzad.

This is Congress' typical characteristic (shirking away from responsibility). says, BJP MP & National Spokesperson Dr Sudhanshu Trivedi.

#RahulDumpsMaharashtra

snippet.title: Did Maulana Saad deliberately infected India? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Explosive Markaz report shows they ‘Wilfully’ infected India, Maulana Saad’s defiance was ‘Deliberate’ & for 2 weeks they ‘Bred’ Corona. ‘Islamophobia’ lobby EXPOSED. ‘Did Maulana Saad wage Corona Jihad?’ 

‘Will the lobby still come to the defence of the Markaz organisers after the Delhi Police has laid out thoroughly how warnings were 'Wilfully' defied by them when holding the event?’

It is true that Tablighi Jamaat was probably criminally stupid and it is also true that the Markaz incident has been used to pan up a certain amount of social tension. says, Senior Advocate Sanjay Hegde.

The biggest Islamic religious centre in Delhi Jama Masjid has categorically said that there will be no gathering. says, BJP's MP & National Spokesperson Dr Sudhanshu Trivedi.

#MarkazCoronaReport

snippet.title: Corona patients & train passengers abandoned, Is Sonia & Sena gangs critics? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Domestic flights resume with new procedures amid Corona pandemic. But old confusion prevails as passengers face turbulence. ‘Who’s behind air anarchy?’ 

TIMES NOW speaks to the top NDA Minister Sadananda Gowda who landed at Bengaluru Airport, directly got into his car & left violating the lockdown norms.

‘I am the pharmaceutical minister, so I am exempted’, says Sadananda Gowda.

Sonia Gandhi-Shiv Sena's unprecedented move EXPOSED for risking public lives. ‘Dangerous’ gag order imposed - after Centre, critics are on target. BJP slams ‘Emergency’ mindset. ‘Containing critics, not Corona?’

‘Isn't the 'Gag order' a form of vendetta following EXPOSES on the Aghadi's failures on the medical infrastructure front and its handling of the migrant crisis in the State?’

Everything is connected to fear. says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

#IndiaTakesOff #SoniaSenaSuperCensor

snippet.title: Randeep Guleria of AIIMS on COVID cases; Are we prepared for the pandemic peak? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
Spike in the number of COVID cases worries. AIIMS Delhi Head Randeep Guleria wades-in & predicts a peak in the number between June & July. Are we prepared for the pandemic peak?

The virus will spread if we’re not responsible enough. Each citizen should behave responsibly now. We have to assess ways how we can reduce the number of cases in the high-risk areas. The needs of migrant workers should be ignored. I think the next 2 weeks will give us an idea about when can we possibly flatten the curve, says Randeep Guleria, AIIMS Director tells Rahul Shivshankar 

Watch Rahul Shivshankar in conversation with Randeep Guleria on INDIA UPFRONT Special Edition.

snippet.title: Will India avert livelihood crisis? |  Piyush Goyal on Atmanirbhar Package | India Upfront
snippet.description:
India eyes road to recovery. As state vows to do the heavy lifting, stimulus underwhelms business.

Atmanirbhar Package has to be seen in continuity with the series of measure PM

snippet.title: How Central Government 'LOCKED' Down Coronavirus | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India witnesses a clash over Coronavirus curve. Fight over COVID-19 numbers doesn’t end even with a 40% ‘robust’ recovery rate & a fatality rate which is one of the lowest. Critics still not convinced. Can they deny India’s graph?

Experts say Lockdown was the right decision. But the curve hasn’t flattened yet & we’re opening up because we’re forced to do it due to economic considerations. The whole world has recognized the fact that India managed the COVID-19 crisis better than many other countries. If the lockdown was not there, he would’ve broken loose in India. We’ve been able to prevent nearly 1.4-2.9 million COVID-19 infections in India due to the lockdown.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Is Aghadi Government lacking in action against COVID-19? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, This will ruin India’s recovery. Shocking violations on camera shows the truth behind 35% of India’s cases. The financial engine in Corona ICU as there is no control & no containment, people sink in Corona cauldron.

In Mumbai, it’s not just mismanagement of the migrant issue but also lapses in containment zones. TIMES NOW travels to the worst affected hotspots, only to find a long queue of migrants, with no precautions taken.

Maharashtra Government has failed the migrants. The migrants were not provided with any kind of relief.  Migrants contribute a lot to the economy of Maharashtra & they should've been looked after. says, Maharashtra  Former CM Devendra Fadnavis.

#MahaCoronaCalamity

snippet.title: India's COVID recovery rate soars, What is story behind the scene? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India’s recovery rate soars. World marvels at resilience. What is the story behind our success? Survivors & doctors will tell you. 

My COVID infection happened during the treatment in the early phases when I was exposed to other infected patients. As I had some medical knowledge, I knew the preemptive measures to be taken so that my condition doesn’t escalate badly. I did have HCQ trial but it didn’t work on me very well. : Dr Veer Gupta, COVID Survivor & Treating COVID Patients, National Health Service London.

We tend to enrol in a particular trial depending on the severity of the condition of the patient. says, Internal Medicine Director Dr Sushila Kataria.

My condition was worsened a little bit initially while I was in a BMC hospital. I got pneumonia & was shifted to a private hospital where I got better. says, COVID Survivor Vindyan Patil.

#IndiaFightsCoronavirus

snippet.title: After Congress' truck sham, Bus stunt fails, Do they need to end 'Farziwada'? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, As vaccine trial gives hope, Corona count crosses 1 lakh. But India’s response rated best as Corona statistics is on India’s side. India leads the world to fight back.

After Rahul Gandhi, now Priyanka Gandhi Vadra EXPOSED. Congress bus 'Stunt' backfires as 1,000 buses exist only on paper; Autos-ambulances are listed as buses. 'Bus betrayal' after truck sham. Migrants par ‘Fazriwada’ bus Karo!

Congress stunt 'Bus-ted' and a fact-check exposes the truth.

A huge crowd of migrant workers gathered outside Bandra Railway Station to board a ‘Shramik Special' train to Bihar. Only people who had registered themselves were allowed to board, rest were later dispersed by police. 

This is ‘Ridiculous’! Autos, tempos in the name of buses. What’s next... Rahul Gandhi lending his tobu tricycle? says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

Not even a single word has come out from U.P’s Health Minister in the last 1 month on Corona crisis. says, Samajwadi Party Spokesperson Ghanshyam Tiwari.

#CongBusKaro

snippet.title: Jammu & Kashmir big step to integration, Will 'Ghar Wapsi' upsets Modi baiters? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Kashmir won’t be ‘Islamist’ ghetto. After scrapping special status, all Indians can settle from today. A big step to Kashmir’s 'integration', but ‘Ghar Wapsi’ upsets ‘PM Modi-baiters’. ‘Backing Islamists not integration?’

Will the decision to start issuing domicile status certificates end the Islamist ghettoization of Kashmir?

Finally, the ‘Crown of India is without thorns’ says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

Where is the domicile for Ladakh? says, Activist Ifra Jan

Scrapping 370 & issuing new domicile rules is not only correcting historical wrong but also ensuring basic rights to those who have been forcibly on religious lines denied. says,  BJP National Spokesperson Nalin Kohli.

Activist Ifra Jan leaves the debate after being slammed on facts.

#KashmirOpenedForAll

snippet.title: NDA tries to bailout Economy but fails to inspire investors? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, NDA tries to bail out economy, but ‘Fails’ to inspire investors. Economists predict ‘Collapse’ saying ‘Growth to contract sharply’. India in deepest ever recession?

There is a large amount of govt guarantee which are important. COVID war is a ‘Marathon’. says,  Principal Economic Advisor Sanjeev Sanyal.

The economic package announced by the NDA Govt is the 1st step in the right direction but at the same time, a lot more needs to be done. There is a need to address the issues of how to effectively open up the economy. says, Kinetic Group's Kinetic Green & Vice Chairperson Founder & CEO Sulajja Firodia Motwani.

Rs 20 lakh crore package is a good start and it takes care of about 70% of India’s population. RBI should say that for the next 1 year there is going to be a loan repayment moratorium for industries. says, Manipal Global Education Chairman Mohandas Pai.

Cash in hand is required to make the establishments keep going. says, Columnist Gurcharan Das.

snippet.title: China lied about COVID count, India wants country to answer | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Leaked report EXPOSES China – have 6,00,000 COVID cases & not 84,000. India wants China to answer & more than 100 nations back probe call. Game up for 'China Corona Cheater'?

It is important for us to know the origin of Coronavirus. This virus was allowed to cross the boundaries, some accountability has to be there.  India has sought a detailed probe on COVID count in China.  says, BJP's National General Secretary Ram Madhav.

BREAKING:  Call for Corona probe rattles China. 'W.H.O probe once the situation is normal', says Xi Jinping.

COVID is not a natural epidemic. It was created in a laboratory.  says, Defence Expert General Bakshi.

There’s no doubt that China has behaved irresponsibly in terms of COVID transmission. says,  Defence Journalist Ajai Shukla.

Studies say there cannot be rapid human transmission from Corona, it takes a generation to occur. says,  Institute of Chinese Studies Author & Adjunct Fellow Zorawar Daulet Singh.

#ChinaCoronaCheater

snippet.title: PM-CM's crucial meeting to put lifeline back on track but Why opposition red flags? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Lockdown slowed Corona spread. Centre readies reboot blueprint as India’s ‘Lifeline’ put back on track. State also puts labour on board. India ‘Express’ gets ‘Green signal’. 

Why’s Opposition raising red flags?

COVID peak is yet to come, probably in the month of June according to some experts. says, Political Analyst MRV.

The lockdown gave us dividends, time to upgrade health infrastructure and reduced the COVID transmission rate. says,  Ex-MP Pavan K. Varma.

It is too early to shift the goalposts. We still don’t know the end of Coronavirus. says, BJP's MP & National Spokesperson Rajiv Pratap Rudy.

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Rahul Gandhi lauds pictures of 'Azadi', Sacrifice of braves insulted? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, As Corona count pushes 50,000 marks, Congress lashes out at Centre & doubts ‘Flattening curve’ claim. TIMES NOW fact check reveals the truth.

Unprecedented scale, scope & planning. Hope for 14,000 Indians stranded abroad as India launches 2nd biggest evacuation. 7 days, 13 countries, 64 flights, 3 warships. TIMES NOW brings you details on routes, times & fares.

Braves sacrifice life for India, but Rahul Gandhi lauds ‘Azadi’ photos & backs prize for ‘Anti-India’ line. Pulitzer calls Kashmir ‘Contested’, but Congress champions ‘Separatism’. Why put Pulitzer over patriots?

snippet.title: Wine Shops permit in States will give green light to COVID-19 cases? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, After migrants’ issue, ‘Madira migraine’ sparks row over green light to liquor sale. Thousands descend to buy booze, States welcome ‘Revenue & relief’. But activists slam license for ‘Lumpens’. 

We cannot open up liquor shops during this pandemic situation. It is highly illegal. says, Consumer Right Activist Prof. Bejon Kumar Misra.

It’s not about liquor parse. I think any product which is popular and people want it, if it comes back to the market after 40 days, we will see some kind of disturbance. says, CIABC Director-General Vinod Giri.

#DaaruPeDangal

Watch!

snippet.title: Hudson's Michael Pillsbury speaks on China-US & COVID-19 | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Michael Pillsbury, Director of the Center on Chinese Strategy, Hudson Institute, Washington, D.C speaks to Times Now's Editor-in-Chief Rahul Shivshankar speaks about China-US relations and Coronavirus impact on the USA. He says, 'U.S President Donald Trump never accused China of releasing the Coronavirus, he started an investigation to see what exactly happened.' He even said that the Chinese have not been shy of accusing the U.S of releasing this virus but we don't want to stoop to the level of defamation. He even warned the Chinese; said, 'If the trade deal is not implemented by China then this will have serious consequences.'
Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: COVID-19 lockdown extended; lives saved but livelihood hurt? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On the special edition of India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss, the end of a 41 day lockdown and the debate which has begun over its efficacy. The time has come to ask some questions as a long road to recovery lies ahead. 
Was this lockdown worth the pain that people have had to face? Was the lockdown effective? Was saving lives more important than livelihood?

snippet.title: Coronavirus doubling rate slows to 11 days, Right time to ease the lockdown? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, 3 days to go for Lockdown 2.0. Doubling rate slows to 11 days, Coronavirus count crosses 33,000. But the spike in Gujarat & Bengal is under the lens. ‘Is it the right time to ease lockdown?’

Day after relief to stranded Indians, lakhs sign up to register for relief. PM Narendra Modi-HM Amit Shah holds intense discussions & 3-point action plan is being readied. 

 Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari recommends Election Commission of India (ECI)  to declare elections for 9 vacant council seats in the State. 9 seats are vacant since Apr 24. The deadline for CM Uddhav Thackeray ends of May 27.

#IndiaFightsCoronavirus

snippet.title: PM Narendra Modi to dilute lockdown, Can States pull it off? | India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Centre offers relief to stranded migrants, students & tourists as they are free to travel back to their States. Opposition welcomes the move but slams delay. Is this a timely relief by Narendra Modi government?

snippet.title: Corona count set to cross 30k mark, What is causing spike? | India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India's COVID count close to 30,000 with over 1200 cases per day since April 19, 60 deaths reported in 24 hours, new cases in 2 green zones. But the recovery rate at 22% gives hope. Government mulls Lockdown 3.0?

Corona count set to cross 30,000 marks. The lens on Madhya Pradesh & Gujarat spike as expert panel studies higher death rate in these States. ‘Is deadlier COVID strain the reason?’

EXCLUSIVE details revealed from PM Narendra Modi-CM lockdown meeting. ‘Restart’ must for revival. ‘What's the 7-point plan?’ 

 NDA's 'restart for revival' plan, TIMES NOW accesses 7-point agenda: 
•Separate curbs for red, orange & green zones in future.
•States to be allowed to restart economic activity in green zones.
• Reopening MSME sector is a priority to sustain migrant workforce
• Centre to provide adequate health infrastructure to States
• Centre looking at bold reforms that touch the lives of the common man
• Use of technology to limit human interaction in the service sector.
• States to promote decentralized marketing & procure to help farmers.

#CovidKillerStrain #IndiaCovidPlan 

Watch!

Subscribe to Times Now | Click Here ► http://goo.gl/U9ibPb

Log on to www.timesnownews.com for the latest news & updates. Give a missed call on 1800 4190 300. Stay updated, stay ahead.’

snippet.title: Nair Hospital's patients suspected of COVID-19 but not tested? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, TIMES NOW accesses death certificates of a hospital in Mumbai which suggests that the bodies of a large number of COVID-19 suspected patients were handed over to relatives without testing.

Serious lapses in BMC Nair Hospital. TIMES NOW’s agenda-setting investigation brings out the anomalies in 17 deaths.

SHOCKING defence by BMC’s Nair Hospital, ‘There was 50-50 probability of Coronavirus amidst the dead. The thorough probe has been done by 2 of our professors and swab reports have been verified’. says, BMC’s Nair Hospital Dean Mohan Joshi.

snippet.description:

On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Corona count nears 6,000 marks and death toll touches 169 in India. The positivity rate is under control. ICMR revises the COVID testing protocol. 

Maharashtra VVIP lockdown racism. Wadhawans 'Violated' norms. 'Fraudsters' got lockdown free pass by citing 'family emergency' as an excuse. 

The government must sit together & discuss a way out for this. A patient must not be asked to pay because that discourages him. says,  Former SG of India, Harish Salve.

We have to remember that private labs have huge operating costs. says, BIOCON Chairperson, Kiran Shaw.

#FreeTestForAll

Watch!

snippet.title: Has India flattened the curve to lift the Lockdown? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, PM Narendra Modi drops a huge hint saying 'Lifting lockdown not easy'. PM to take call in 72 hrs as experts cite rising COVID curve & State to push for lockdown extension. Is 'Stay home' the new normal? 

List of containment zones in East Delhi is out: 
Mandawali Gali No. 1, Pandav Nagar H Block Gali No. 1, Khichripur Gali No. 1-3, Kishan Kunj Ext Gali No. 4. 

A lot of people might lose their lives not because of Corona but because of its effect on the economy. says, EX-MP Pavan Varma.

#LockdownCoronavirus

snippet.title: Lockdown to be over soon, What's next for India? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Only 7 days left for April 15. As India asks what’s next, 4 hints hold the answers. NDA’s 6-point matrix to decide.

Inside details of NDA's lockdown exit plan. Prime Minister Narendra Modi likely to interact with CMs on April 11th. 

TIMES NOW accesses 6-point matrix submitted to PMO for the lockdown exit plan.  

PARAMETER 1: No. of people diagnosed with COVID-19
PARAMETER 2: No. of Corona patients hospitalized
PARAMETER 3: No. of Corona deaths in a district
PARAMETER 4: No. of asymptomatic people under watch
PARAMETER 5: Density of population in district & cases
PARAMETER 6: %age of people above 60 years in the district

#April15Suspense

Watch!

Subscribe to Times Now | Click Here ► http://goo.gl/U9ibPb

Log on to www.timesnownews.com for the latest news & updates. Give a missed call on 1800 4190 300. Stay updated, stay ahead.’

snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the 21-day lockdown ends on April 15th. PM Narendra Modi takes stock of Corona war & urges states to draw an 'exit plan' but experts are divided on the next step. He said, 'It is important for states to formulate a common exit strategy. Need to ensure staggered re-emergence of people after lockdown. What are India's options? Will the lockdown be extended? What next step will India take economically and medically?

snippet.title: Has Jamaat willfully defied Janta curfew? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, 25% of positive Corona cases in India have been traced to Tabligh. They broke the law and even ignored PM Narendra Modi's pleas. Is Jamaat willfully sabotaging India?  

Delhi Police has sent a notice to Nizamuddin Markaz Tablighi Jamaat's chief Maulana Saad. The notice has been received by his kin.

The motive of the Markaz is best defined by their faith. says,  Political Analyst, Dr Syed Asad Abbas.

I think it is highly irresponsible for the members of the Jamaat to not cooperate with the doctors. says,  Indian Muslim Foundation & Attendee, Tablighi Jammat  President, Jamai Shoaib.

#TablighDefiesIndia

On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, 7 days after Janta Curfew, 21-day lockdown is showing results. The trend is against community surge & India is not going the ‘Italy’ way. Is PM Narendra Modi  Lockdown model working? TIMES DATA PROJECTION that suggests India has an edge over other countries in dealing with the Coronavirus crisis.

PM Narendra Modi sets up ‘PM-CARES’ Relief Fund to fight against Coronavirus. But ‘Modi-baiters’ raise objections and link ‘PM-CARES’ name to ‘Personality cult’.

The lens on 1,400 Islamic scholars who landed in Delhi from abroad. They defied quarantine, ‘infected’ 11 and ‘risked’ many more. Drones flew in to evacuate. Who put faith above health?

#BharatWillDefeatCorona  #FightCoronaNotModi #DelhiCoronaScare 

Watch!

snippet.title: National lockdown day 3, Will it pass Doctors test? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, On Day 3 of lockdown, no alarming spike in COVID cases. New theory gives reasons as statistics spark hope. Experts put theory to test. 

Lockdown on its own may not be sufficient. It must be accompanied by developing a very strong capacity for public health at the community level. says, WHO’s Special envoy Dr David Nabarro.

snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar,  PM Narendra Modi's Corona 'Samvaad' motivates India via Kashi. PM uses 'Mahabharata' analogy to defeat the crisis saying 'conquer Corona in 21 days'.

snippet.description:

snippet.description:

snippet.title: PFI funded anti-CAA stir; What is the sabotage-'Syndicate' behind it? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the visuals of violence that shook the nation may not have been the outcome of a spontaneous backlash against the parliament in passing the Citizenship Amendment Act. The Enforcement Directorate has concluded that there is a direct link between the violent clashes over CAA. The ED even designated a radical organization like the Popular Front of India (PFI).
If the claim is true then the opposition and the right's lobby's attestation that these protest against the wit of the parliament was spontaneous falls flat. Times Now has accessed some of the allegations made in the probe report. The report states that 73 bank accounts which were linked to PFI had received funds up to ₹120 crores from 4th of December till the 6th of January. 
Watch the ground report!
What explains the link between deposits & withdrawals by PFI in banks across anti-CAA hot spots in Western U.P?

#TukdeFundedCAAStir

Subscribe to Times Now | Click Here ► http://goo.gl/U9ibPb

Log on to www.timesnownews.com for the latest news & updates. Give a missed call on 1800 4190 300. Stay updated, stay ahead.’

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Students become pawns in politics; Plot behind JNU Jinnah jung? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Nirbhaya was raped and brutalized seven years ago. The rapists will hang to death on January 22. A lot of public pressure mounted for justice. Most of all, it is Nirbhaya’s mother's dogged efforts that have finally found fruition. 

Debate 1:

From ‘Free Kashmir’ to ‘Jinnah’ jibe, politics muddies the waters over JNU violence. earlier, Jamia, Jadavpur, & now JNU. Danga is the motive under the cloak of dissent. Students reduced to Pawns. What is the plot behind JNU Jinnah Jung?  

Debate 2:
3 FIR's filed in 24 hours. 20 'LEFT' Students booked in case. JNU President, Aishe Ghosh also charged in violence. ABVP not even mentioned. Unmasked on Newshour but unknown to Delhi Police. 

#JNUJinnahJung

Watch!

Log on to www.timesnownews.com for the latest news & updates. Give a missed call on 1800 4190 300. Stay updated, stay ahead.’

snippet.title: Key GST meet on 18th December, Is it time for an overhaul? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, there is speculation over the GST rate hike in India, but Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman denies the ‘rumours’. Key meeting to take place on December 18.
At a time when the economy is facing a slowdown, will it be prudent to bring exempted items under tax net? Is it time for an overhaul in the GST? Will it be wise to raise rates under GST when the Centre has cut corporate tax rates recently?

#GSTJoltSoon

India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar is a new age debate show separating news from propaganda. Every night at 8PM IST, arguments are put forth basis the hard facts, for the nation to assess on TIMES NOW by TIMES NOW’s Editor-in-Chief, Rahul Shivshankar. The show focuses on facts that gives the viewer a clear picture of the latest news, issues and a perspective that helps India make a decision on where they should stand.

snippet.title: Supreme Court under attack for Ayodhya verdict, Is review driven by politics? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, A controversy has erupted over the Ayodhya verdict after a five-judge bench has unanimously ruled in the favour of handing over the title of Babri Masjid-Ram Janam Bhumi site to the Hindu (mandir side). A number of influential personalities from the Masjid side believe that the judgement is morally flawed. 
Nationwide debate erupts after Masjid side plans to review Ayodhya verdict. ‘Review is not an appeal’, says Harish Salve. Is review driven by politics?

snippet.title: Uddhav Thackeray scores own goal by dumping BJP alliance; Hindutva sold for satta? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Uddhav Thackeray's dream of becoming Maharashtra's CM vanished away as the deadline given to Shiv Sena by Governor has passed. 
The Shiv Sena on Monday claimed that the NCP and Congress have agreed "in-principle" to back its government without the BJP in Maharashtra but failed to get letters of support from the political rivals before the deadline set by the Governor who rejected its plea for three more days to do so.
Have the political tactics of Shiv Sena backfired them?
Who's the winner in this power battle?
#SenaBetraysHindutva

localized.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Uddhav Thackeray's dream of becoming Maharashtra's CM vanished away as the deadline given to Shiv Sena by Governor has passed.

Have the political tactics of Shiv Sena backfired them?

snippet.title: Will sun set on Gandhi era as Ek Bharat narrative takes root? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
BJP set to sweep assembly polls with the incumbent governments sharing partnership with Shiv Sena in Maharashtra and ruling on their own in Haryana. The opposition has tried to make this about economic mismanagement and how both the states have taken a beating under the NDA's watch in the last 5 years.
Will the sun set on the Gandhi family era as ‘Ek Bharat’ narrative takes root?
Is this India’s turning point election?

#AssemblyElections2019

snippet.title: Bihar sinks due to heavy rains, State shifts onus to nature? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, incessant rains wreaked havoc in the state of Bihar with the death toll rising to 29. Flooded streets & waterlogged rail tracks are a common sight in most of the state now. Even Deputy CM Sushil Modi wasn't spared. he had to be rescued from inside his flooded home by the NDRF. It probably giving him a taste from what the 'Aam Aadmi' in Bihar are facing.

#NitisSinksBihar

snippet.title: Ghazwa-e-Hind a new enemy of India, will Lutyens believe now? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, an attempt to Robbery in Delhi’s Farsh Bazaar area. One of the two suspects was apprehended while another one managed to flee away. Delhi has turned from the National capital to the capital of crimes in the last few days. snippet.title: Chandrayaan-2 moon landing, Why is it historic? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar tonight, There are some moments in history that are best described as epical, India's soft touchdown on the lunar south pole will be one of those moments. Our scientist began only with their genius. Vikram Sarabhai after which the lander has been named. The crucial landing of 'Vikram', Chandrayaan-2's moon lander, will be carried out by at least eight onboard equipment in a coordinated manner. 

When you leave the edge, you discover things people never ever even dreamt of: Astrophysicist Neil Degrasse Tyson, tells Rahul Shivshankar on India Upfront. Listen in!

snippet.title: Amnesty hits back with Kashmir stunt, vendetta fuels blackout myth? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Amnesty International India launched a global campaign to highlight the cost of the communication blackout in Kashmir. Issuing a statement, Amnesty International India head Aakar Patel said that the 'blackout cannot be prolonged any further by the Indian Government as it has grossly impacted the daily lives of Kashmiri people, their emotional and mental well-being, medical care, as well as their access to basic necessities and emergency services.'

Amnesty International’s propaganda relies on ‘sketchy reports’. Centre demolishes ‘fakery’. Is vendetta fueling blackout myth?

On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss possibly the greatest fall from grace, P Chidambaram, the former Union Home Minister & 4-time Finance Minister has landed in Tihar jail no 7 for 14 days. Even the Apex Court gives no relief to the Former Finance Minister, refuses to review the 'kingpin' tag.

#ChidambaramInTihar

snippet.title: Legacy data traded to illegals, citizenship scam on Hindus? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, in a sensational twist to the raging debate over the NRC, a member of the Assam Government. appointed panel claims that 90% Hindus are on the list of those excluded from the citizenship survey. An insider from the Assam government goes on record with a sensational claim. He claims legacy data has been traded to illegals to exclude Hindus as part of a colossal citizen survey scam.

Has appeasement politics by so-called secular parties looked for vote-banks permanently disadvantaged Hindus?

snippet.title: List of terrorists released, Is exposing terror communal? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, 1993 Mumbai blasts mastermind Dawood Ibrahim, Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Masood Azhar, Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) chief and 26/11 attacks mastermind Hafiz Muhammed Saeed, and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) chief Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi have been declared individual terrorists under the newly-amended Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Act.
List of ‘terrorists’ released. Congress doubted NDA’s intent. Is exposing ‘terror’ communal?

snippet.title: Cong protests DK Shivakumar's arrest, holding law to ransom? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, After DK Shivakumar was arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation, Congress leaders resort to violent protests in various places across the country. Several Youth Congress workers were detained on Wednesday following a scuffle with police personnel during a protest against the arrest of the party's Karnataka leader DK Shivakumar.

snippet.title: Kashmiri citizens reject separatism, Is this not normalcy? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Pictures of ordinary Kashmiris that are praising the PM Modi government even as others line up to serve the Indian State. This visual evidence disproves the continuous stream of negative news on Kashmir. The source of this news is self-styled rights activists, armchair Kashmir experts and opposition leaders who have been raking this issue up. They have all painted scenarios ranging from how the Army after the NDA's 370 decision is picking up and torturing 'youth', to how the residents of the Valley are waiting to erupt into a million mutinies.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Fake news campaign being run to sabotage NDA's efforts on J&K?| India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
The government is under severe attack from Pakistan. Several opposition parties led by the Congress & a group of hyper activists and a number of foreign and Indian media publications for diluting article 370. They have been opposing the abrogation of article 370 on almost a daily basis.
Some of these leadersh ave even challeged this decision to integrate Kashmir with India in the Supreme Court. A dangerous fake news campaign has been launched on social media to create an anti-NDA environment and influence the judiciary to rule against the PM Modi government. 

Will NDA's 370 decision lead to Kashmir's total emotional integration with India?

#Article370Debate

snippet.title: GDP slips to 5% this quarter, what led to this sharp fall? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the Indian economy grew 5% annually in the first quarter of FY2020, slowing from a 5.8% growth in the march, missing market expectations. The GDP growth for the April-June quarter of the current financial year, slowed to 5%, its slowest pace in over six years. It was the weakest growth rate since the first quarter of 2013. 

What led to this sharp fall in the growth?

#GDPFreeFall

snippet.title: Abrogation to stand legal scrutiny? | Harish Salve on Art 370 | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, ahead of decisive 370 SC hearing. India’s legal giant Harish Salve breaks silence on Art 370. Destroyed Pakistan at The Hague. Now, dissects NDA’s decision to dilute Art 370. What is Salve’s verdict? Hear the voice Indians must-hear. 
Harish Salve in an exclusive conversation with Rahul Shivshankar said, 'Abrogation of article 370 is not unconstitutional. Article 3 of 370 allows the President to make changes; this was a special provision to deal with J&K.'

Watch to know more!

snippet.title: ISI-Imran nexus EXPOSED, will they still say 'talk to Imran'? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the Modi government has been putting the talks with Imran Khan's Pakistan on hold as he is a front for the Army & ISI. It is even said that he is a slave to their policy of cross border terror.
A group of Pakistani apologists have been attacking the Indian Modi government for suspending talks saying that Imran is a good man and that the Indian government is trying to isolate him, punish him because they want to score points with its Hindu vote bank, but today the Modi government stood vindicated as  a recent report prepared by the US Congress research service concludes that the Pakistan Army exerting influence over Pakistan's foreign and security policies.

#ImranIsAPuppet

snippet.title: Kashmir to Koregaon, India being maligned by fake news? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, TIMES NOW EXCLUSIVE FACT CHECK. The ‘Khan Market’ gang stands exposed. A few intellectuals purposely pushed a narrative over the last 24 hours to discredit the probe and weaken the case against the suspected Maoist sympathiser accused of playing a role in the deadly Bhima-Koregaon riots of 2018. The judge questioned the accused of possessing a copy of the Leo Tolstoy classic, 'War & Peace.' Many people like Swara Bhaskar, Jairam Ramesh, Prashant Bhushan suggested that the judge and the prosecution were bumbling ignoramuses.

While no one should be jailed for possessing political literature can Lutyens trolls who spread fake news to discredit the judge hearing the Bhima Koregaon riot case be absolved? 

#WarAndPeaceFakery

snippet.title: Was violence instigated to disturb peace in Kashmir? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Shah Faesal who is a former IAS officer and currently a politician in Kashmir, along with others like Sheila Rashid have challenged the centre's decision to revoke Article 370 in the Supreme Court. They have also filed a habeas corpus petition after Faesal was stopped from flying out of the country.
Times Now accesses affidavit filed by J&K government in the habeas corpus petition of Shah Faesal in the Delhi High Court.
The affidavit claims that Faesal obtained a tourist visa & not a student visa.

snippet.title: FM gives revival roadmap, Bailout a substitute for stimulus? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On the special edition of India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Indian economy is in a tailspin, and the fact is that the slowdown is very much underway. A recession might just be around the corner because of the global headwinds. If one goes according to the inverted bond yield curve; the demand for short term government bonds goes above the demand for long term government bonds, the economies have tended to hit. 
India’s growth story splutters & FM announces a ‘bailout’ package. Is bailout a substitute for stimulus?

#EconomyRevivalDebate

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Army nails plot against peace, Shehla's fake news EXPOSED | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Debate breaks out over Shehla Rashid’s anti-Army tweets after Forces brand her revelations ‘fake news’. Supreme Court lawyer Alakh Alok Srivastava on Monday filed a criminal complaint against student leader Shehla Rashid, seeking her arrest for allegedly spreading fake news against Indian Army and the government. The complainant alleged that she has intended to excite disaffection towards the government, which is prima facie an offence of sedition under Section 124-A of IPC.
 We ask- ‘Has Opposition support emboldened ‘Tukde gang’?’

snippet.title: Boost for NDA's case, Outraged Malaysians gun for Zakir Naik | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Malaysian authorities have decided to summon Indian Islamic preacher Zakir Naik for questioning for his alleged racially sensitive remarks against ethnic Hindu and Chinese communities. Naik had recently said that Hindus in Malaysia had “100 times more rights” than the Muslim minority in India and that they support Prime Minister Narendra Modi and not Mahathir Mohamad, the prime minister of Malaysia.
Outraged Malaysians gun for Zakir Naik. 115 complaints against Zakir in Malaysia. 
Support in govt dwindling for Zakir and stage set for Zakir’s isolation. 

#ZakirAbusesHindusAgain

snippet.title: Pak won't adopt N-restraint, Why must India wait & watch? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh dropped subtle hints that India could be open to altering its long-stated No First Use policy on nuclear doctrine. "Pokhran is the area which witnessed Atal Ji’s firm resolve to make India a nuclear power and yet remain firmly committed to the doctrine of ‘No First Use’. India has strictly adhered to this doctrine. What happens in future depends on the circumstances," Singh said in a tweet after visiting Pokhran where he paid homage to former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

Can India afford to stick to its no-first-use stand as Pak threatens nuke blackmail?

#IndiaNukeWarning

snippet.title: Economic outlook is grim, core sector is sluggish; What's the road to revival? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
Unmissable signs that economy is slowing down. There is a list of indicators that confirm that the problem has reached criticality;

Here is the list of Indicators

1. Jan-March 2019 GDP growth at 5.8%
2. India Inc's June quarter earnings missed profit forecasts
3. Car sales down by over 30%
4.  Jan-March 2019: retail loan growth at 7.3%
5. June 2019: Core sector growth at 0.2 vs 7.8% last year
6. April-June 2019: Fiscal Deficit at Rs 4.32 Lakh  crore
7. Indian companies announced projects worth Rs 43,400 crore in quarter 1

We ask: What's the road to revival?

Join Rahul Shivshankar with Baijayant Jay Panda, Sanjay Baru, R Jagannathan, Senior Economist Prof. Arun Kumar, & Economist Dr. Rohit Azad decode it on Special Edition of India Upfront

1. Jan-March 2019 GDP growth at 5.8%
2. India Inc's June quarter earnings missed profit forecasts
3. Car sales down by over 30%
4.  Jan-March 2019: retail loan growth at 7.3%
5. June 2019: Core sector growth at 0.2 vs 7.8% last year
6. April-June 2019: Fiscal Deficit at Rs 4.32 Lakh  crore
7. Indian companies announced projects worth Rs 43,400 crore in quarter 1

We ask: What's the road to revival?

Join Rahul Shivshankar with Baijayant Jay Panda, Sanjay Baru, R Jagannathan, Senior Economist Prof. Arun Kumar, & Economist Dr. Rohit Azad decode it on Special Edition of India Upfront

As India celebrates merit of its scientists but Congress credits Nehru. In India’s moment of glory, Congress shines the torch on Nehru. Ansari was beaten up by a mob in Dhatkidih village in Jharkhand’s Seraikela district on June 17 on suspicion of bike theft and was forced to chant 'Jai Sri Ram'. The victim succumbed to his injuries on June 22.

snippet.title: Fight for power & money, not 'Azaadi,' What will peaceniks say to this? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront, Padmaja Joshi gets the truth of the  Burhan Wani. Major General Asif Ghafoor, the spokesperson of the country's Armed Forces, hailed slain terrorist Burhan Wani as a hero. Ghafoor took to his Twitter handle to hail the terrorist on his third death anniversary for his "commitment, dedication and sacrifices."
This is not the first time that Pakistan has hailed the former commander of Hizbul Mujahideen. In 2017, the then Prime Minister of the country Nawaz Sharif had said that Wani's death had "infused a new spirit of struggle for freedom" in the Kashmir Valley.
This fight is for power & money, not Azaadi.
What will peaceniks say to this?

snippet.title: US catches India by surprise over Iran, but doesn't name Pak? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the Indian External Affairs Minister Jai Shankar was upstaged by U.S Secy of state Mike Pompeo who caught him completely by surprise when he suggested that Iran was a state sponsor of terror. He said, 'We all know that Iran is the world's largest state sponsor of terror and Indian people have suffered from terror around the world. We have a shared understanding of the threat and a common purpose to ensure that we can keep the energy at the right prices and deter this threat.'

Although Iran has been a great friend of India and by injecting a dynamic and not referring to Pakistan in the same sentence. It appears that the Americans have gotten away by imposing their very own priorities.

Ansari was beaten up by locals in Saraikela Kharsawan district early on Tuesday on the suspicion of theft. snippet.title: Indira hailed as 'Maa Ganga' by Cong, but PM Modi abused? | India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury insults PM Narendra Modi in House. He says, ‘Kaha Maa Ganga, kaha gandi naali.’ As some BJP MPs taunted by saying we don't say that Indira is India and India is Indira. Chowdhury reacted by saying, "Kahan Maa Ganga aur kahan gandi naali."His shocking statement drew flak from BJP MPs in Parliament, who demanded the words be expunged. The speaker expunges remark from the records of the Parliament. Adhir Ranjan also apologised for his remarks, terming it as a 'misunderstanding'
saying that his Hindi isn't good. Watch the show to know more!

snippet.title: RaGa mocks Yoga day & forces, disrespect sparked by defeat? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:

Are critics of Rahul Gandhi deliberately confusing an attempt at humour with genuine insult?

Why should a tweet mocking dogs performing Yoga be interpreted as an insult to the armed forces?

snippet.title: Sonia cheers for army valour, but Rahul disrespects forces? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, while President Kovind has praised surgical strikes in Parliament today, Congress President Rahul Gandhi has seen rather disinterested. 
Sonia Gandhi has cheered for Army’s valour, but Rahul stopped Sonia mid-track. President Kovind on Thursday addressed a joint sitting of both houses of Parliament, the Rajya Sabha and the Lok Sabha.

We ask: By disrupting Sonia’s applause, isn’t Rahul only emboldening army baiters? When Rahul Gandhi has distanced himself from those who questioned the surgical strikes, can he be accused of disrespecting the forces? If Rahul Gandhi is genuinely proud of our armed forces, can he explain why he stopped Sonia Gandhi from applauding the valour of forces during Balakot?

snippet.title: Makkal hit by water crisis, but Neta's get it home delivered? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Investigation by TIMES NOW shows CM & VVIPS in water-parched Chennai are helping themselves to 27,000L/day of water for free. What’s more, it is home delivered. If you feel cheated, we want to hear from you. 
Tamil Nadu has been reeling under one of its worst-ever crisis in history. Four reservoirs supplying water to the city of Chennai have almost dried up this summer. The delay in the arrival of monsoon rains has compounded the problem.
We ask- Does the expose prove that the Tamil Nadu CM Edapaddi Palaniswami and his colleagues have little respect for the rights of the public?
Haven’t the ministers and state’s CM Edapaddi Palaniswami defrauded the people of Chennai by surreptitiously cornering precious water resources for themselves?
By serving themselves first and not the public in a time of crisis, has the CM Palaniswami and his cabinet relinquished their claims on the office?

#VVIPWaterLoot

snippet.title: Bihar hospitals exposed, Who is responsible for the deaths? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, the death toll in Bihar is climbing relentlessly, it is heartbreaking to see the mothers are leaving hospital cradling dead children. Even the most stone-hearted person would show some compassion, but not Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. 
Cauldron of death boils over as parents protest apathy & negligence. Shaken CM Nitish finally visits SKMC Hospital but refuses to even meet one bereaved parent. Has time to meet the powerful but not the poor of Bihar? 

We ask-  Has PM Narendra Modi Government made a mockery of its own ‘perform or perish’ mantra by not sacking even one errant official? Judging by his indifference to the parents, did Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar only visit the hospital to pose for the cameras?
If Dr. Harsh Vardhan hasn’t fulfilled his promises made in 2014, shouldn’t he quit on moral grounds?
Why haven’t criminal cases been filed against those whose negligence has led to this catastrophe?

#BiharChildDeaths

snippet.title: More than 100 children dead, Is the onus on the Mantri's? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, more than 100 children have died because of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). The first sign of this crisis came about two weeks ago but the Ministers in Bihar did nothing about it. Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan should have called for an urgent review meeting with the Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar 10 days ago. When he was questioned he snubbed the media. MoS Health Ashwini Choubey was spotted yawning and allegedly ‘snoozing.’

We ask- Why are the majority of the spokespersons and senior leaders from the JDU  and BJP avoiding questions from the media?
Is this the ‘ease of living’ and ‘ache din’ that NDA promised to bring on returning to power?
Having failed to prevent the deaths of more than 100 children, shouldn’t the union health minister and the Bihar health minister step down? 
Can the Deputy Chief Minister be out of the state when the state is dealing with a severe health crisis?
Can Netas in Bihar absolve themselves of any accountability for the crisis, having failed to prevent deaths despite outbreaks in the past?
Shouldn’t Dr Harsh Vardhan have summoned an urgent meeting during the start of the outbreak to take preventive measures? 
Doesn’t the conduct of MoS health and Bihar state health minister indicate a lack of seriousness in dealing with a tragedy?
By singling out consumption of lychee as the reason for the outbreak, are Netas evading accountability for their failure to improve medical infrastructure?

#BiharChildDeaths

snippet.title: Cong covers-up 'jihadi atankwad' Why this face saver for Pak? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar tonight, As Prime Minister Narendra Modi exposes Pakistan-sponsored Jihadi terror at the SCO even as Imran Khan looks on helplessly. But, Times Now accesses proof to show that Congress is saving Pakistan’s face. Congress has undone all good work by giving Pakistan face saver that virtually absolves it of exporting Jihadi terror. Watch documented proof of how!

We ask - By deleting the word ‘Jihad’ as one of the reasons for the thorny ties between India and Pakistan, why is the Congress seeking to save Pakistan’s face? What vested interest does the Congress have in linking Hindu faith to terror but delinking Islamist hate from cross border terror? By deleting ‘Jihad’ and adding the Hindu Mahasabha to the list of divisive organisations, isn’t the Congress playing a dangerous game of dividing India? When organisations like the JEM and the LET have openly spoken of the need to wage Jihad against India, what is preventing Congress from accepting the ‘truth’? Listen in!

#CongSavesPakFace

snippet.title: Rattled by doctors’ protest, Is Didi engineering Civil War? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:

 Mamata Banerjee gave an ultimatum, said, 'We have to bring Bangla forward. When I go to Bihar, UP, Punjab, I speak in their language, if you are in Bengal you have to speak Bangla. I will not tolerate criminals who stay in Bengal and roam around on bikes.'
Amid a doctors' strike in her state, Mamata Banerjee said outsiders were involved in the hospital protests and warned non-Bengali speakers.
Rattled by doctors’ protest, Didi hunts down ‘outsiders.’ ‘Is Didi engineering Civil War?’

snippet.title: PM Modi pledges 'Sabka Vikas' but hatemongers continue to issue dire threats? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledges 'Sabka Vishwas' but hatemongers won't listen; vow to continue lynchings. This is the reality on the ground! Who has issued a licence to lynch?
When hatemongers issue dire threats can PM Narendra Modi dismiss fear among minorities as a myth?

Do repeated references to AICC in the cash log seized by the I-T dept mean re-routing of money to Congress?
Does reference to 'Aahaar' in the receipt log seized by I-T refer to money 'extracted' from mid-day meal scheme?
Do the logs seized by the Income Tax department reveal exchequer money being re-routed to the party?

WATCH!

On the debate tonight, top Gathbandhan general on tape, reveals underhand anti-Modi ploy, ‘in Masjid’s we’ll convince Muslims’, preach secularism, oppose Hindutva, but use Islam to win ‘99% Muslims’.
A few days ago, Rahul Gandhi said that the ally which will face PM Modi's NDA is based on secular beliefs, but this move has raised many questions.  
Is this Gathbandhan’s secularism?
Can the election commission guarantee that Masjids will not be used to bank votes?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Is Rahul lying about Azhar to swing elections in his favour? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, Is Rahul Gandhi lying on national security issues to swing elections in his favour? The truth is out in black & white. As Rahul blames BJP for freeing Masood Azhar, Cong ‘Insiders’ in their own words expose his claims.
Having passed the onus completely on the government at the time on whether or not to release Azhar, do Rahul Gandhi's accusations of the BJP being ‘weak’ in handling the crisis hold any credibility?

snippet.title: When terror lashes our border can there be cricket bonhomie? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
BCCI refuses to take a stand. Puts the onus on Centre. No clear statement on Pak's boycott. 
 Has war solved any problem? After 2004, Atal Ji told me that had he got one more term he would have solved the Kashmir issue. During the Kargil war, India and Pak played cricket during World Cup (1999)
Why can't BCCI issue a clear statement on boycotting Pak in the World Cup?
 Isn't a wishy-washy response from BCCI an insult to martyred jawans?
By dragging its feet on boycotting, is BCCI trying to mock the sentiment of a nation?
Why hasn't the BCCI made the letter written to ICC on playing cricket with Pakistan public? 
Watch to know more!

snippet.title: Time to isolate 'Terroristan', Can India unite to boycott Pakistan? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about how decades ago Father of our Nation, Mahatma Gandhi broke the back of British by boycotting their goods and products.
Today, to fight the terrorists, there is a need to isolate the nation which is supporting terrorism.
Has the time come to honour the national sentiment of boycotting all things from Pakistan?
From cinema to cricket, shouldn't India unite to ensure Pakistan feels the pinch?
From cricket, culture to commerce, who’s stopping India from uniting to teach Pak a lesson?
If Pak can unite to condone terror, why can't the lobby in India unite to condemn & boycott Pak?
Are commercial consideration preventing the BCCI from taking a clear stand against Pak?

snippet.title: Angry India demands justice, Can the Modi government deliver? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Mortal remains of 40 Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel martyred in the Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) attack in Pulwama were brought to New Delhi on Friday. The martyrs who served us selflessly, who guard our borders without exception, who worked day and night and sometimes sacrificing their own sleep to ensure we can live privileged existences. 
Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid his tributes to the martyrs at Palam Airport, Delhi. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Union Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore, Congress president Rahul Gandhi and Army Chief General Bipin Rawat also paid tributes to the martyred CRPF jawans.
Will the Modi government deliver justice?
#JusticeForIndia

snippet.title: Congress targets BJP chief Amit Shah, Sick 'SUAR KA ROG' slur | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
In the debate tonight, we will talk about something which has been in politics for the last 25 years. Bad mouthing and talking bad about opposition political leader is a thing to be in news.
Senior Congress leader B K Hariprasad mocked the health condition of BJP president Amit Shah, saying he contracted swine flu since his party made an alleged bid to destabilise the Congress-JDS government in Karnataka. The remark by Hariprasad, a Rajya Sabha MP and Congress general secretary, sparked an angry reaction from the BJP with the party's Karnataka unit calling him a "rogue" and described his remarks as "shameless" that showed his party's "culture" and his "mental stability". 
When it is equally guilty of resorting to name calling especially when it comes to minorities can the BJP today cry victim? Listen in for more details!

snippet.title: BJP slams Rahul over Rafale tape, Is he relying on 'fakery'? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Rahul Gandhi, Congress President had to suffer a setback today as The Rafale story took a tabloidish turn in the Lok Sabha. Rahul Gandhi had to make a face turning U-Turn after introducing an audio tape of a pupated conversation of a BJP Goa Minister, which made stunning disclosures of Rafale deal. If this tape is authentic, then it raises fresh questions over Rafale deal, piloted by the NDA.
Arun Jaitley, Finance Minister bashed Congress President as he called him a liar and said that the tape is fake.
It's obvious that BJP is running scared f what facts are contained in this tape. Listen in!

snippet.title: Vande Mataram blocked in MP, purge against 'Patriotism'?| India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
The newly elected Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath, one of the first things that he has done after getting into power is that, he has reversed the 13-year-old culture which is mandating Government employees to sing the national song Vande Mataram on every first day of the month, this culture has been stopped by the new Chief Minister, saying that National Song is communal in nature. Kamal Nath has listed several reasons for this action.
By identifying a National song with a particular community, Kamal Nath is undermining secularism. Listen in!

snippet.title: Muslims in Noida ordered not to pray in public, Pragmatic or polarising? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
Uttar Pradesh police have ordered companies in Noida to stop their employees from praying Namaz in public gardens or public areas, stating that the prayer causes inconvenience.
Muslims have been ordered to not pray in public areas and should pray in the office premises or a closed area.
Yogi Adityanath's government has ordered this rule against a minority to pray which is a right of any citizen to pray anywhere and anytime according to the constitution of India.
Companies will be held responsible if anyone is seen praying in an open area. Listen in to know more!

snippet.title: Jump in ease of doing business a major boost for 'Modinomics'?| India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
In a big boost for Narendra Modi government, India climbed another 23 points in the World Bank’s ease of doing business ranking to 77th place, becoming the top ranked country in South Asia for the first time and third among the BRICS. In the last two years the country has climbed 53 notches, a performance matched in the past only by Bhutan. The biggest gain was in construction permit where India climbed 129 ranks to 52nd place on the back of targeted government effort to remove hurdles. Listen in!

snippet.title: Urdu Gita-Ramayan opposed, secularists citing saffron push? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
There is displeasure in the state of Jammu and Kashmir at all the institutes of learning to stock, a copy of an Urdu translation of the Bhagavad Gita and Ramayana. A circular has been sent out to mark the contribution of a renowned Kashmiri writer Sarwanand Premi towards spreading the tenets of Hinduism among the locals.
Isn't blocking Hindu sacred texts in direct violation of the principles of 'secularism'?Why are libraries and classrooms, which are temples of learning, being communalised?

snippet.title: Amritsar train tragedy, Did Sidhus risk lives of people? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Is it still ‘Parmatama ka Prakop’ for Sidhu after his wife indulged her sycophants at the cost of people’s lives? Why didn’t Navjot Kaur take an objection to her crony who indulged in sycophancy over safety? Why hasn’t Sidhu’s wife yet accepted the responsibility for her role in goading people to stay on tracks? Will Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh now sack Punjab Minister Navjot Sidhu for his wife’s role in playing with the lives of people? Has the tape exposed the complicity of Navjot Kaur and her cronies who egged on the crowd to stay on tracks?

snippet.title: Major rail mishap in Punjab, Tragedy strikes Dussehra day | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Amritsar train accident: 61 people were killed after a crowd of Dussehra revelers that had spilled onto railway tracks while watching the burning of a Ravana effigy was run over by a train near Joda Phatak. At least 61 people were killed Friday evening after a crowd of Dussehra revelers that had spilled onto railway tracks while watching the burning of a Ravana effigy was run over by a train near Joda Phatak here. The injured were admitted to different hospitals in Amritsar. A video of the tragic incident showed that several people were run over by a train when they were watching the burning of an effigy of demon king Ravana, as part of the Dussehra celebrations. 
Listen in!

snippet.description:

snippet.description:

A part of the arterial Majherhat bridge between Taratala and Mominpur in Alipore area collapsed at around 4.45 pm during rush hour over rail tracks. One person was killed and several others were trapped.
